Who We Are

Our Vision

Why Choose Us?

 Services We Offer

Visa Consultations and Requirement Preparation

With Kaya, your journey starts with a confident step. We provide you with accurate consultations and secure all visa requirements for various global destinations, with expertise that guarantees you a seamless process and travel without complications.

Certified Translation Services

Every document matters. That's why we offer certified translation services accepted by embassies and official bodies within and outside Jordan, with precision that opens doors for you without delay.

University Admissions

Your academic ambition deserves the best opportunities. We assist you in securing accepted university admissions in the most prestigious global universities, with easy steps and continuous support until you reach your study seat.

U.S. Cultural Exchange Visas

Open a window to the world. With Kaya, you get American cultural exchange visas to live new experiences, whether in study, work, or volunteering, and we accompany you through every procedure until you confidently start your adventure.

Hotel Booking Services

From a quick business trip to a family vacation or a luxury honeymoon, we provide you with hotel bookings worldwide at competitive prices and options to suit all tastes.

Comprehensive Travel Plan

Your trip is not just a ticket; it's a complete experience. We design a personalized travel plan that combines your desires and needs, with flexibility and professionalism that ensures your peace of mind and enhances your chances of obtaining the visa by preparing a convincing and clear comprehensive file.

Health Travel Insurance

Your safety is our priority. We offer comprehensive health insurance packages covering your tourist, study, or business trips, so you can travel assured that everything is under control.

Flight Bookings

From the first take-off to the final landing, we provide you with flight tickets to various countries around the world, with options that suit your budget and schedule, in addition to diligent tracking of the best offers and times.

files.Antigua and Barbuda Citizenship by Inves:
Antigua and Barbuda Citizenship by Investment (CBI)

In a world where freedom of movement and global opportunities are increasingly important, Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean offer you an exceptional opportunity to secure a more stable future for yourself and your family, with a powerful passport that opens the doors to the world.

Overview

Antigua and Barbuda, a charming Caribbean nation, boasts 365 white-sand beaches and turquoise waters. Its economy relies on tourism and financial services, making it an ideal destination for living and investment.

Why Choose Antigua and Barbuda?

Powerful Passport: Grants entry to over 150 countries.

Fast and Reliable Program: Efficient application process.

Attractive Tropical Environment: Promising investment opportunities.

Family Inclusion: Ability to include family members in one application.

Qualification Options

Investment in an approved Real Estate project.

Donation to the National Development Fund (NDF).

Contribution to the University of the West Indies (UWI) Fund (especially beneficial for families).

How to Obtain Citizenship 

Citizenship is granted through a streamlined process that includes applying via an authorized agent, selecting the preferred investment route, passing a rigorous due diligence check, and finally receiving citizenship.

Processing Time The application typically takes between 6 to 9 months.

Investment Requirement Minimum investment starts from USD 230,000.

Key Benefits: Enjoy broad visa-free travel privileges and the ability to include family members under a single application.

Location Overview Antigua and Barbuda is situated in the Eastern Caribbean, north of Guadeloupe and south of Saint Kitts.

Passport Ranking: 26th globally, with access to 151 destinations

Capital: St. Johnâ€™s

Official Language: English

Time Zone: GMT-4

Land Area: 440 kmÂ²

Government Type: Parliamentary constitutional monarchy

Visa-Free Access with Antigua and Barbuda Passport 

Holders of this passport can travel without a visa to approximately 120 countries, including: Albania, Germany, Andorra, Anguilla, Ireland, Iceland, Spain, Estonia, Italy, Argentina, Uruguay, Ecuador, Paraguay, Barbados, Bahamas, Belgium, Belize, Poland, Puerto Rico, Brazil, Bulgaria, Turkey, Trinidad and Tobago, Chile, Czech Republic, Tunisia, Jamaica, British Virgin Islands, US Virgin Islands, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Dominica, Grenada, Montserrat, Mauritius, Vanuatu, Fiji, Micronesia, Seychelles, Samoa, Costa Rica, Colombia, Peru, Venezuela, Suriname, Guyana, Guatemala, El Salvador, Mexico, United Kingdom, Netherlands, France, Portugal, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Austria, Switzerland, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia, Greece, Malta, Cyprus, Romania, Hungary, Serbia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Kosovo, Georgia, Moldova, South Africa, Morocco, Jordan, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, Lebanon, Ghana, Namibia, Lesotho, Eswatini, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, the Philippines, Hong Kong, Macau, South Korea, Japan, and more.

Visa on Arrival (Approx. 30 Countries) Available in countries such as: Nepal, Maldives, Cambodia, Laos, Tanzania, Uganda, Kenya, Madagascar, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Togo, Benin, Burkina Faso, Rwanda, Marshall Islands, Palau, Timor-Leste, Comoros, Seychelles (entry stamp upon arrival), Iran, Jordan (also available on arrival), Bolivia, Nicaragua, and Fiji (entry stamp upon arrival).

Electronic Travel Authorization (Approx. 5 Countries) Accessible for: 

Canada 

Australia 

New Zealand 

Sri Lanka (eTA)

Kenya (available both as eTA and visa on arrival).

Visa Required Prior to Travel Entry is only permitted with a pre-approved visa for: 

United States 

China (excluding Hong Kong and Macau) 

Russia 

Most Middle Eastern countries (Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Algeria) 

Select African nations (Congo, Sudan, Eritrea) 

Several Central Asian countries (Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, North Korea).

eVisa Required Before Travel (Approx. 10 Countries) Includes: 

India 

Pakistan 

Azerbaijan 

Vietnam 

Myanmar 

Turkey (available both via eVisa and standard entry) 

Ethiopia 

Bangladesh 

CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire

Nigeria.



Essential Application Requirements

Before choosing the appropriate country, all applicants for Caribbean Citizenship by Investment programs must meet these general conditions:

Legal Age: The main applicant must be at least 18 years old.

Good Conduct and Character: The applicant must possess a good reputation and sound character.

Clean Criminal Record: Applicants with criminal records or pending cases are not accepted.

Good Health: The applicant must be in good health and free from serious infectious diseases.

Financial Capability: Proof of the legal and transparent source of funds.

Pass Due Diligence: All applicants undergo a meticulous security and financial screening to ensure credibility.

Get Your Antigua and Barbuda Citizenship Now!

files.Dominica Citizenship by Investment (CBI):
Dominica Citizenship by Investment (CBI)

In a world where freedom of movement and global opportunities are increasingly important, Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean offer you an exceptional opportunity to secure a more stable future for yourself and your family, with a powerful passport that opens the doors to the world.

Overview

Dominica, the "Nature Isle of the Caribbean," is famous for its rainforests, volcanoes, and hot springs.

Why Choose Dominica?

Oldest CBI Program: Operating since 1993, offering reliability and stability.

Low Cost: Competitive cost compared to other countries.

Powerful Passport: Grants entry to over 140 countries, including China.

Flexibility: A reliable and flexible program, ideal for families.

Qualification Options

Donation to the Economic Diversification Fund (EDF).

Investment in an approved Real Estate project.

Method of Acquisition: 

Submit the application through an authorized agent, select the investment option, pass the security screening, then receive citizenship.

Duration 

The process usually takes between 6 to 9 months after submitting the application and completing all documents and security checks. 

In some expedited cases, it may take between 3 to 6 months.

Investment Value 

Starting from USD 200,000, or a donation of USD 100,000 to the National Fund.

Significance 

A reliable and flexible program, ideal for families.

Location 

Eastern Caribbean, between Guadeloupe and Martinique. 

Passport Ranking: 31st globally (143 destinations) 

Capital: Roseau 

Language: English + French Creole 

Time Zone: GMT-4 Area: 750 kmÂ² 

Form of Government: Parliamentary Republic.



Freedom of Movement with the Dominica Passport

Visa-Free Travel with Dominica Passport Visa-Free: (around 112 countries)

All Schengen Area countries in Europe (Germany, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland)

United Kingdom and Ireland

Most Caribbean countries (Antigua & Barbuda, Saint Kitts & Nevis, Saint Lucia, Grenada, Barbados, Jamaicaâ€¦)

South America (Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Uruguay)

Asia (Singapore, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia)

Africa (South Africa, Morocco, Tunisia, Botswana, Mauritius, Seychelles)

Visa on Arrival: (around 25 countries)

Nepal, Maldives, Cambodia, Laos

Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Madagascar, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Togo

Marshall Islands, Palau, Micronesia, Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa

Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA): (3 countries)

Canada (eTA)

Australia (eTA)

New Zealand (eTA)

Visa Required:

United States of America

China (except Hong Kong & Macau)

Russia

Most Middle Eastern countries (Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Algeria)

Some African countries (Congo, Sudan, Eritrea)

Some Central Asian countries (Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, North Korea)

Pre-Approved Electronic Visa (eVisa): (around 8 countries)

India

Sri Lanka

Turkey (eVisa)

Azerbaijan

Vietnam

Ethiopia

Bangladesh

Ivory Coast



Essential Application Requirements

Before choosing the appropriate country, all applicants for Caribbean Citizenship by Investment programs must meet these general conditions:

Legal Age: The main applicant must be at least 18 years old.

Good Conduct and Character: The applicant must possess a good reputation and sound character.

Clean Criminal Record: Applicants with criminal records or pending cases are not accepted.

Good Health: The applicant must be in good health and free from serious infectious diseases.

Financial Capability: Proof of the legal and transparent source of funds.

Pass Due Diligence: All applicants undergo a meticulous security and financial screening to ensure credibility.

Get Your Dominica Citizenship Now!

files.St. Kitts and Nevis Citizenship by Inves:
St. Kitts and Nevis Citizenship by Investment (CBI)

In a world where freedom of movement and global opportunities are increasingly important, Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean offer you an exceptional opportunity to secure a more stable future for yourself and your family, with a powerful passport that opens the doors to the world.

Overview

St. Kitts and Nevis is the smallest sovereign state in the Western Hemisphere, yet it holds the title for the oldest Citizenship by Investment program, established in 1984.

Why Choose St. Kitts and Nevis?

Powerful Passport: Grants entry to approximately 154 destinations worldwide.

Oldest Program: The longest-running and most established CBI program, signifying stability and trust.

Fast and Reliable: Efficient and reliable processing procedures.

Stable Investment Environment: A secure place for financial contributions or real estate investments.

Qualification Options

Contribution to the Sustainable Growth Fund (SGF).

Investment in an approved Real Estate project.

Method of Acquisition 

Submit the application through an agent, choose the investment option, pass the security screening, then receive citizenship.

Duration 

The process usually takes between 6 to 9 months after submitting the application and completing all documents and security checks. In some expedited cases, completion can be achieved within just 4 to 6 months.

Investment Value 

Starting from USD 250,000.

Significance 

The oldest and strongest citizenship program in the Caribbean.

Location 

Leeward Islands, Eastern Caribbean. 

Passport Ranking: 25th globally 

Capital: Basseterre 

Language: English 

Time Zone: GMT-4 Area: 269 kmÂ² 

Form of Government: Federal Constitutional Monarchy

Visa-Free Travel with Saint Kitts & Nevis Passport

Visa-Free: (around 124 countries)

All Schengen Area countries in Europe (Germany, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland)

United Kingdom and Ireland

Most Caribbean countries (Antigua & Barbuda, Dominica, Saint Lucia, Grenada, Barbados, Jamaicaâ€¦)

South America (Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Uruguay)

Asia (Singapore, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia)

Africa (South Africa, Morocco, Tunisia, Botswana, Mauritius, Seychelles)

Visa on Arrival: (around 25 countries)

Nepal, Maldives, Cambodia, Laos

Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Madagascar, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Togo

Marshall Islands, Palau, Micronesia, Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa

Bolivia, Nicaragua, Iran (visa on arrival at certain airports)

Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA): (3 countries)

Canada (eTA)

Australia (eTA)

New Zealand (eTA)

Pre-Approved Electronic Visa (eVisa): (around 8 countries)

India

Sri Lanka

Turkey (eVisa)

Azerbaijan

Vietnam

Ethiopia

Bangladesh

Ivory Coast

Visa Required:

United States of America

China (except Hong Kong & Macau)

Russia

Most Middle Eastern countries (Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Algeria)

Some African countries (Congo, Sudan, Eritrea)

Some Central Asian countries (Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, North Korea).



Essential Application Requirements

Before choosing the appropriate country, all applicants for Caribbean Citizenship by Investment programs must meet these general conditions:

Legal Age: The main applicant must be at least 18 years old.

Good Conduct and Character: The applicant must possess a good reputation and sound character.

Clean Criminal Record: Applicants with criminal records or pending cases are not accepted.

Good Health: The applicant must be in good health and free from serious infectious diseases.

Financial Capability: Proof of the legal and transparent source of funds.

Pass Due Diligence: All applicants undergo a meticulous security and financial screening to ensure credibility.

Get Your St. Kitts and Nevis Citizenship Now!

files.Saint Lucia Citizenship by Investment (C:
Saint Lucia Citizenship by Investment (CBI)

In a world where freedom of movement and global opportunities are increasingly important, Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean offer you an exceptional opportunity to secure a more stable future for yourself and your family, with a powerful passport that opens the doors to the world.

Overview

Saint Lucia is a stunning volcanic island, famous for its iconic "Pitons" mountains. It is a world-class tourist destination.

Why Choose Saint Lucia?

Flexible Program: Offers multiple investment options.

Powerful Passport: Grants entry to 140+ countries.

Attractive Natural Environment: Ideal for living and investment.

Newest Options: One of the most flexible and modern CBI programs in the Caribbean.

Qualification Options

Financial Contribution to the National Economic Fund (NEF).

Investment in an approved Real Estate project.

Purchase of Government Bonds.

Method of Acquisition 

Submit the application through an agent, choose the investment option, pass the security screening, then receive citizenship.

Duration 

6 to 9 months, which may sometimes extend to 12â€“18 months in cases of file backlog or delays in security checks.

Investment Value Starting from USD 240,000.

Significance The newest and most flexible Caribbean citizenship program.

Location North of Trinidad & Tobago and south of Martinique. 

Ranking: 32nd globally 

Capital: Castries 

Language: English 

Time Zone: GMT-4 Area: 617 kmÂ² 

Form of Government: Constitutional Monarchy

Visa-Free Travel with Saint Lucia Passport

Visa-Free: (around 112 countries)

All Schengen Area countries in Europe (Germany, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland)

United Kingdom and Ireland

Most Caribbean countries (Antigua & Barbuda, Dominica, Saint Kitts & Nevis, Grenada, Barbados, Jamaicaâ€¦)

South America (Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Uruguay)

Asia (Singapore, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia)

Africa (South Africa, Morocco, Tunisia, Botswana, Mauritius, Seychelles)

Visa on Arrival: (around 25 countries)

Nepal, Maldives, Cambodia, Laos

Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Madagascar, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Togo

Marshall Islands, Palau, Micronesia, Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa

Bolivia, Nicaragua, Iran (visa on arrival at certain airports)

Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA): (3 countries)

Canada (eTA)

Australia (eTA)

New Zealand (eTA)

Visa Required:

United States of America

China (except Hong Kong & Macau)

Russia

Most Middle Eastern countries (Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Algeria)

Some African countries (Congo, Sudan, Eritrea)

Some Central Asian countries (Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, North Korea)

Pre-Approved Electronic Visa (eVisa): (around 8 countries)

India

Sri Lanka

Turkey (eVisa)

Azerbaijan

Vietnam

Ethiopia

Bangladesh

Ivory Coast



Essential Application Requirements

Before choosing the appropriate country, all applicants for Caribbean Citizenship by Investment programs must meet these general conditions:

Legal Age: The main applicant must be at least 18 years old.

Good Conduct and Character: The applicant must possess a good reputation and sound character.

Clean Criminal Record: Applicants with criminal records or pending cases are not accepted.

Good Health: The applicant must be in good health and free from serious infectious diseases.

Financial Capability: Proof of the legal and transparent source of funds.

Pass Due Diligence: All applicants undergo a meticulous security and financial screening to ensure credibility.

Get Your Saint Lucia Citizenship Now!

Grenada Citizenship by Investment (CBI)

In a world where freedom of movement and global opportunities are increasingly important, Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean offer you an exceptional opportunity to secure a more stable future for yourself and your family, with a powerful passport that opens the doors to the world.

Overview

Grenada, known as the "Spice Isle," is characterized by breathtaking natural beauty, white-sand beaches, and tropical rainforests. It is famous for its production of nutmeg and cocoa, and is considered a safe and stable tourist and investment destination.

Why Choose Grenada?

E-2 Visa Eligibility: The only Caribbean country that grants eligibility for the US E-2 Investor Visa, opening doors to residency and work in the United States (a major advantage).

Powerful Passport: Grants entry to over 147 countries, including China (Visa-Free)â€”a unique benefit among Caribbean CBI programs.

Secure Investment Environment: A safe investment environment with a growing economy.

Qualification Options

Donation to the National Transformation Fund (NTF).

Investment in an approved Real Estate project.

Method of Acquisition 

Submit the application through an authorized agent, choose the suitable investment option, pass due diligence, then receive citizenship.

Duration 

4 to 6 months, which may extend to 9 months in cases of file backlog or delays in security checks.

Investment Value 

Starting from USD 220,000.

Significance 

Exceptional advantage: eligibility to apply for the U.S. 

E-2 Investor Visa, opening doors to residence and work in the United States.

Location 

Situated north of Trinidad & Tobago and south of Saint Vincent in the Eastern Caribbean. Passport Ranking: 31st globally (147 destinations) 

Capital: St. Georgeâ€™s 

Language: English 

Time Zone: GMT-4 Area: 348 kmÂ² 

Form of Government: Parliamentary Constitutional Monarchy

Visa-Free Travel with Grenada Passport

Visa-Free: (around 114 countries)

All Schengen Area countries in Europe (Germany, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland)

United Kingdom and Ireland

Most Caribbean countries (Antigua & Barbuda, Dominica, Saint Kitts & Nevis, Saint Lucia, Barbados, Jamaicaâ€¦)

South America (Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Uruguay)

Asia (Singapore, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia)

Africa (South Africa, Morocco, Tunisia, Botswana, Mauritius, Seychelles)

China (special advantage of Grenada passport compared to other Caribbean passports)

Visa on Arrival: (around 17 countries)

Nepal, Maldives, Cambodia, Laos

Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Madagascar, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Togo

Marshall Islands, Palau, Micronesia, Vanuatu, Fiji, Samoa

Bolivia, Nicaragua, Iran (at certain airports)

Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA): (3 countries)

Canada (eTA)

Australia (eTA)

New Zealand (eTA)

Visa Required:

United States of America

Russia

Most Middle Eastern countries (Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Algeria)

Some African countries (Congo, Sudan, Eritrea)

Some Central Asian countries (Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, North Korea)

Pre-Approved Electronic Visa (eVisa): (around 8 countries)

India

Sri Lanka

Turkey (eVisa)

Azerbaijan

Vietnam

Ethiopia

Bangladesh

Ivory Coast



Essential Application Requirements

Before choosing the appropriate country, all applicants for Caribbean Citizenship by Investment programs must meet these general conditions:

Legal Age: The main applicant must be at least 18 years old.

Good Conduct and Character: The applicant must possess a good reputation and sound character.

Clean Criminal Record: Applicants with criminal records or pending cases are not accepted.

Good Health: The applicant must be in good health and free from serious infectious diseases.

Financial Capability: Proof of the legal and transparent source of funds.

Pass Due Diligence: All applicants undergo a meticulous security and financial screening to ensure credibility.

Get Your Grenada Citizenship Now!

files.Second Passport.docx:
Second Passport

Your Step Towards Second Citizenship and a Freer Life

Second Passport... Your Freedom to a Borderless World

In today's world, owning a second passport has become more than just a luxury; it is a strategic investment in freedom of movement, security, and the future. Through Citizenship by Investment (CBI) programs in the Caribbean islands, you and your family can obtain a second citizenship that grants you new opportunities for travel, education, and business, far from traditional visa restrictions.

Why a Second Passport?

Owning a second passport grants you:

Freedom of Movement to over 140 countries worldwide.

Financial and Legal Security for your family.

Education and Career Opportunities in stable environments.

Tax Flexibility and Asset Protection.

At Kaya, we guide you with expertise and transparency to choose the most suitable program from the top five Caribbean nations offering Second Citizenship:



Antigua and Barbuda

Open the doors to the world with one passportâ€¦ Over 151 destinations await you!

[Click Here for All Requirements and Details]

Dominica

Your new citizenship is your ticket to 141 borderless destinations.

[Click Here for All Requirements and Details]

St. Kitts & Nevis

From the moment you acquire citizenship... a world opens up to you, including 154 destinations and more.

[Click Here for All Requirements and Details]

Saint Lucia

Move your borders, and head towards 142 destinations around the world with one citizenship.

[Click Here for All Requirements and Details]

Grenada

Your new passportâ€¦ your key to a world without restrictions, with more than 145 destinations.

[Click Here for All Requirements and Details]



âš ï¸ Important Notes

The detailed lists (names of countries for each category) are constantly updated by the governments.

We always recommend referring to our website or official sources for the latest version.

Why Choose Kaya for Second Citizenship?

Local and Global Expertise: We understand market requirements and translate them into practical solutions.

Complete Transparency: We accompany you step-by-step until you receive your second passport.

Customized Solutions: Whether you are a businessperson, a family seeking a better future, or an individual striving for travel freedom, we design the optimal program for you.

Start Your Journey Today

With Kaya, your second passport is not just a document; it's a key to a new world of opportunities. Secure freedom of movement, future security, and investment flexibility for yourself and your family.

[Contact Us Now for Your Free Consultation.]

files.Tourist, Visitor, and Medical Treatment:
Tourist, Visitor, and Medical Treatment Visas (B1-B2)

General Overview

The B1-B2 visa is one of the most common US visas, also known as the Visitor Visa. It is intended for individuals wishing to enter the United States temporarily for multiple purposes such as:

B1 (Business): For short-term business activities like meetings, conferences, contract signings, or attending workshops.

B2 (Pleasure/Medical): For tourism, visiting family and friends, or receiving medical treatment.

The two types are often combined into a single visa (B1/B2), giving you greater flexibility to travel for business, pleasure, or medical reasons.

Why Choose the B1-B2 Visa?

Freedom of Mobility: Allows you to visit the United States temporarily, usually for up to 6 months.

Multiple Purposes: You can combine tourism with attending meetings or receiving medical treatment in the same trip.

Ease of Use: No need for a work contract or prior university admissionâ€”only proof of your intent to return after the visit.

Exploration Opportunity: Visit iconic U.S. landmarks such as the Statue of Liberty, Disneyland, or enjoy the natural beauty of the Grand Canyon.

Essential Requirements

A valid passport.

Proof of your intention to return to your home country after the visit (such as a job, family, or property), which is primarily ascertained during the personal interview.

For Medical Treatment: Medical reports and a treatment plan from a US hospital or health center.

It is advisable to provide proof of financial capacity to cover travel and accommodation costs.

Application Steps

Fill out the DS-160 form online.

Complete the steps on the dedicated website and pay the visa fee.

Schedule an appointment at the US Embassy or Consulate.

Attend the personal interview and submit the required documents.

After visa approval: Submit the passport and wait for the visa to be printed.

Required Documents During the Interview (Key Documents)

The DS-160 Visa Application Form confirmation page.

The Visa Fee Payment Receipt.

A recent personal photo according to US specifications (5x5 cm size, white background).

The Appointment Confirmation Form.

Supporting Documents (Non-Mandatory) such as:

Invitation letters from relatives or US entities.

Medical reports (in case of treatment).

Bank statement for the last 6 months to prove financial capacity.

Cost of Tourism, Visit, and Medical Treatment Visas (B1/B2)

The official application fee is currently USD 185 per applicant.

This fee is fixed regardless of the purposeâ€”tourism (B2), family visit (B2), medical treatment (B2), or short-term business (B1)â€”since they are usually combined into a single visa (B1/B2).

Important Notes:

After filling out the DS-160 application, completing the steps, and paying the fee, you can book the interview appointment.

There may be additional costs if you use visa service providers or intermediary offices.

In case the application is rejected, the fees are non-refundable.

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultations to determine the most suitable visa type for you.

Complete preparation of your file according to embassy requirements.

Proper preparation for the personal interview to increase the chances of obtaining the visa.

Following up on your application step by step until the visa is received.

Note: The fee value may vary depending on the application method you choose, whether directly through Kaya or through accredited service providers.

Enjoy a safe and smooth trip to the United States with Kaya â€” let us prepare everything you need to easily and confidently obtain your B1-B2 visa.

files.Academic Study Visas (F1-F2).docx:
Academic Study Visas (F1-F2)

General Overview

The United States is the primary destination for international students seeking high-quality education and an exceptional academic experience. Through the F1-F2 visas, US universities welcome hundreds of thousands of students annually, who become part of a global academic community featuring the most prestigious institutions like Harvard, MIT, Stanford, and Yale.

These visas not only grant you the opportunity to study but also open up broad professional and cultural horizons, allowing your family to accompany you throughout your study period.

What is the F1 Visa?

It is designated for students wishing to pursue full-time academic study at universities, colleges, private high schools, or English language institutes.

It grants the student the right to reside throughout the study period, with the possibility of extension or transfer to other programs.

It allows access to practical training programs:

Curricular Practical Training (CPT): Allows the student to work up to 20 hours per week during the academic semester. It enables obtaining a Social Security Number (SSN) and provides practical experience directly related to your academic major.

Optional Practical Training (OPT): Grants the student an opportunity for paid work for 12 months after graduation. It can be extended for an additional 24 months for students in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) fields.

After the OPT period, the student becomes eligible to apply for an H1B work visa if they secure an employment contract from a US company.

What is the F2 Visa?

The F2 visa is granted to the student's family members (spouse and unmarried children under 21 years of age).

It allows them to reside in the US throughout the primary student's study period.

Note: F2 visa holders can enroll in non-academic or part-time educational courses, but they are not permitted to work.

Key Advantages

World-class education at the most prestigious US universities.

Future professional opportunities through practical training (CPT and OPT).

The possibility of family reunification via the F2 visa.

A rich cultural experience in one of the most diverse and open countries.

Requirements for University Admission in the United States 

Admission requirements vary depending on the type of academic program, but in general they can be summarized as follows:

English Language Programs (ESL or Pathway)

Valid passport.

Proof of financial ability to obtain the I-20 form.

No language test (TOEFL/IELTS) required; admission is often conditional upon completing the language program before transitioning to the academic major.

Diploma and Bachelorâ€™s Degree

High school diploma or equivalent.

Valid passport (at least 6 months beyond the study period).

Proof of financial ability.

Language requirements:

TOEFL iBT (usually 61â€“80) or IELTS (5.5â€“6.0).

Some universities accept conditional admission with enrollment in a language program.

Some universities may require SAT or ACT for international students, especially in competitive majors.

Masterâ€™s Degree

Bachelorâ€™s degree with a good GPA (usually at least 2.5 out of 4; some universities may accept lower GPAs under certain conditions).

Valid passport.

Proof of financial ability.

Language requirements:

TOEFL iBT (usually 79â€“90) or IELTS (6.5).

Some universities offer conditional admission if the student enrolls in a language program.

Additional tests depending on the field:

GRE (for science, engineering, and mathematics programs).

GMAT (for business administration programs).

Academic recommendation letters + Statement of Purpose.

Doctoral Degree (PhD)

Masterâ€™s degree with a good academic record.

Proof of financial ability.

Valid passport.

Language requirements: TOEFL iBT (90â€“100) or IELTS (7.0).

Additional requirements depending on the university:

Research Proposal.

Strong academic recommendation letters.

Academic CV including research or publications.

GRE required in some scientific fields.

Important Notes

Conditional Admission: A common option for students who have not yet met language requirements, where admission is granted on the condition of completing a language program or passing a test later.

Medical and Law Programs: These fields have special requirements and may not accept conditional admission.

Deadlines: Application deadlines vary by university, but most fall semester programs close between December and April.

Details of Conditional Admission

English Language Requirements

Some universities accept students with scores slightly below the required TOEFL or IELTS threshold.

In such cases, enrollment in an intensive language program (ESL or Pathway) within the university is mandatory.

After completing the program or achieving the required score, the student transitions directly into the academic major.

Academic GPA

Universities may grant conditional admission to students whose GPA is slightly below the requirement.

The condition is that the student maintains a certain GPA during the first semester or completes prerequisite courses.

Prerequisite Courses

In some fields (such as engineering or business administration), students may be required to complete foundational courses before entering the main program.

Example: A Master of Business Administration applicant may be asked to study accounting or economics if their undergraduate degree is not closely related.

Missing Documents

Universities sometimes grant conditional admission if the student has not submitted all required documents (such as the final graduation certificate or academic recommendations).

The student is given a deadline to provide them before starting studies or during the first semester.

Additional Tests

Some Masterâ€™s and PhD programs may grant conditional admission pending submission of GRE or GMAT results.

In this case, the student begins with language studies or certain courses, then submits the test results later.



Advantages of Conditional Acceptance:

Allows the student to start the study journey even without meeting all initial requirements.

Reduces time wastage, as language or preparatory courses can be taken at the same university.

Grants the student an opportunity to adapt to the American academic environment before entering the major.

Important Notes

Not all U.S. universities offer conditional admission; the most flexible are Community Colleges and regional public universities.

Medical and law programs usually do not accept conditional admission.

It is essential to ensure that conditional admission includes the issuance of the I-20 form, as it is required to obtain the student visa.

Visa Requirements

Obtain official university acceptance and Form I-20.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee online.

Complete the DS-160 Visa Application Form.

Pay the Visa Fee ($185 USD).

Schedule an interview appointment at the US Embassy or Consulate.

Attend the interview and submit the required documents.

Important Note: After receiving the visa, you must travel to the United States within 30 days before the start date of the academic semester. Travel is not permitted earlier than this or after the program has begun, otherwise the visa may be cancelled and you may be sent back from the airport.

Required Documents During the Interview

DS-160 Visa Application Form confirmation page.

Payment receipts for the Visa Fee and SEVIS Fee.

University acceptance letter and Form I-20.

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm size, white background).

Bank statement for the last 6 months to prove financial capacity.

Academic certificates and transcripts (recommended to bring).

Cost of Academic Study Visas (F1-F2)

Official Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185 per applicant (whether F1 for the student or F2 for the dependent).

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 350 for the student (F1). No SEVIS fee is charged for dependents (F2).

University Application Fees

Most US universities and institutes charge a mandatory Application Fee when submitting an admission request, which is non-refundable upon rejection.

Range: Usually between $0 â€“ $250 USD, varying by program type and institution prestige.

This fee is paid separately from the visa fee and SEVIS fee and is an essential step before the issuance of the Form I-20.

Additional Notes:

The SEVIS fee is paid after receiving Form I-20.

Fees are non-refundable even if the application is rejected.

Other costs may be added (e.g., shipping the acceptance letter, certificate equivalency fees).

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultations to choose the appropriate university or institute.

Professional preparation of your academic and financial file.

Follow-up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Additional support for your family in case of F2 visa application.

Fulfill your academic dream in the United States with Kaya â€” let us accompany you step by step from university acceptance to your study seat.

files.Vocational Study Visas (M1-M2).docx:
Vocational Study Visas (M1-M2)

General Overview

If you are looking for specialized practical education that quickly opens the doors to the job market, the M1-M2 visas are your best choice. These visas are intended for students who wish to pursue vocational or technical programs in the United States, away from the traditional academic path.

From aircraft maintenance technician programs to culinary and arts institutes, and from industrial training in electricity, mechanics, and carpentry to beauty and design schools, these visas grant you the opportunity to learn specialized skills that qualify you directly for a professional career.

What is the M1 Visa?

It is designated for international students who wish to enroll in non-academic vocational or technical programs.

Fields include:

Aircraft Maintenance Technician programs.

Culinary and Applied Arts Institutes.

Programs in Electricity, Mechanics, Carpentry, or Industrial specializations.

Beauty and Design schools.

The duration of stay is tied to the length of the training program, with the possibility of extension in certain cases.

What is the M2 Visa?

It is granted to the student's family members (spouse and unmarried children under 21 years of age).

It allows them to reside in the US throughout the period of the primary student's study.

Important Information: M2 visa holders are not permitted to work or study full-time, but they can enroll in short, non-academic courses.

Key Advantages

Specialized practical education that opens job opportunities immediately after graduation.

Short-term programs compared to academic study, saving time and costs.

Diversity of fields, from technical to arts, to suit various interests.

The possibility of family reunification via the M2 visa.

Admission Requirements for Vocational Programs

A valid passport for at least 6 months beyond the study period.

Proof of financial capacity to cover program and living costs (bank statement for the last 6 months).

Adequate English proficiency (TOEFL or IELTS may be required for some programs).

Obtaining an official acceptance from an accredited vocational institute or school.

Receiving the Form I-20 from the educational institution.

Visa Requirements

Payment of the SEVIS I-901 fee.

Completion of the DS-160 Visa Application Form.

Payment of the visa fee.

Scheduling an appointment at the US Embassy or Consulate.

Attending the personal interview and submitting the required documents.

Application Steps

Obtain acceptance from an accredited vocational institute or school.

Receive Form I-20 and pay the SEVIS fee.

Fill out the DS-160 form online.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Schedule an appointment at the US Embassy or Consulate.

Attend the personal interview with the required documents.

Important Note: After receiving the visa, you must travel to the United States within 30 days before the start date of the training program. Travel is not permitted earlier than this or after the program has begun, otherwise the visa may be cancelled and you may be sent back from the airport.

Required Documents During the Interview

DS-160 Visa Application Form confirmation page.

Payment receipts for the Visa Fee and SEVIS Fee.

Acceptance letter and Form I-20.

Appointment confirmation document.

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm size, white background).

Bank statement for the last 6 months.

Previous educational qualification certificates (optional).

Cost of Vocational Study Visas (M1-M2)

Official Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185 per applicant (whether M1 for the student or M2 for the dependent).

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 350 for the student (M1). No SEVIS fee is charged for dependents (M2).



Program Admission Fees (M1-M2)

When applying to a vocational institute or school in the United States, most program providers require an Application Fee as part of the registration procedures. This fee is essential before the issuance of the Form I-20 required for the M1 visa application.

Range: Admission fees usually range between $0 â€“ $300 USD, varying according to the program and the educational institution.

Refund Policy: These fees are non-refundable, even if the application is rejected.

Note: Admission fees are paid separately from the visa fee and the SEVIS fee.

Other Potential Costs Related to Admission:

Shipping of admission documents via courier companies (DHL, FedEx, Aramex).

Certificate equivalency fees if the institute requires it.

Important Notes

Dependents (M2) only pay the Visa Fee ($185 USD), without the SEVIS fee.

Fees are non-refundable even if the application is rejected.

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultations to choose the most suitable vocational program for you.

Professional preparation of your academic and financial file.

Follow-up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Additional support for your family in case of M2 visa application.

Note: The value of the fees may vary depending on the application method you choose, whether directly through Kaya or through accredited service providers.

Start your professional journey in the United States with Kaya â€” from institute acceptance to receiving the M1-M2 visa, we are your partner every step of the way.

files.U.S. Physician Program (J-1 Visa).docx:
U.S. Physician Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

The J-1 Physician visa allows international medical graduates (IMGs) to enroll in Graduate Medical Education (GME) or specialized fellowship programs at accredited American hospitals and medical schools. The program aims to transfer medical expertise and enhance scientific exchange between the United States and other countries, with the expectation that the physician will return to their home country to contribute to the development of the healthcare sector.

Permitted Activities

Participation in Residency programs.

Enrollment in Fellowship specialty programs.

Clinical and research training in American university hospitals.

Attending medical conferences and scientific seminars as part of the program.

Medical Residency Programs

What is Medical Residency? It is a mandatory training program for physicians after graduating from medical school. It combines intensive practical training with direct clinical work with patients. Residency provides advanced experience that qualifies doctors to obtain a license to practice their specialty in the United States.

Duration of Residency Varies by specialty:

Internal Medicine, Pediatrics, Family Medicine: 3 years

General Surgery: 5 years

Neurosurgery, Cardiac Surgery, Orthopedic Surgery: 6â€“7 years

Subspecialties: may require additional fellowship after residency

Available Specialties There are more than 30 specialties accredited by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education (ACGME), including:

Internal Medicine

General Surgery

Pediatrics

Emergency Medicine

Anesthesiology

Dermatology

Psychiatry

Orthopedic Surgery

Neurosurgery

Admission Process (Match System) 

Applications are submitted through the NRMP â€“ National Resident Matching Program, known as â€œThe Match.â€ Admission depends on:

USMLE Step 1 and Step 2 CK exam results

Medical CV

Letters of Recommendation

Personal interviews with programs

International Medical Graduates (IMGs)

Must obtain ECFMG (Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates) certification before applying.

They participate in the same Match system but face additional challenges such as high competition and language requirements.

Benefits of Residency

Intensive practical training in an advanced medical environment.

Receiving a Residency Salary (ranging from $55,000 â€“ $70,000 annually).

Paving the way for Fellowship or subspecialization.

Enhancing the CV with internationally recognized American experience.

Challenges

Intense competition, especially in prestigious specialties.

Long training period and high workload (80 hours per week in some programs).

The Two-Year Home Country Requirement (212(e)) for J-1 physicians (unless a Waiver is obtained).

In short: Residency programs are the crucial step that transforms a medical graduate into a certified specialist, considered one of the most challenging and essential stages in the medical path.

Specialized Fellowship Programs

What is Fellowship?

Fellowship is an advanced training program for physicians who have completed their Residency. It focuses on Subspecialties that require additional skills and expertise, qualifying the physician to work as a Consultant in that specific field.

Duration of Fellowship 

The length varies depending on the specialty:

Cardiology: 3 years

Hematology/Oncology: 2â€“3 years

Cardiothoracic Surgery: 2â€“3 years

Nephrology: 2 years

Gastroenterology: 3 years

Interventional Radiology: 1â€“2 years



Difference between Residency and Fellowship

Residency: General training in a core specialty (e.g., Internal Medicine).

Fellowship: Advanced training in a precise subspecialty (e.g., Interventional Cardiology).

Benefits of Fellowship

Gaining advanced expertise in a precise subspecialty.

Greater job opportunities in prestigious medical centers.

Higher salaries after completion compared to only residency graduates.

Enhancing the CV with advanced American experience.

Program Duration and Requirements

Duration: Typically extends according to the length of the medical training program (3 to 7 years). Can be extended annually with ECFMG and sponsor approval.

Core Requirements:

Medical degree from a recognized university.

Passing USMLE Step 1 & Step 2 CK (essential for ECFMG application).

Obtaining the ECFMG Certificate.

Acceptance letter from an ACGME-accredited Residency or Fellowship program.

Valid passport and proof of financial support.

Application Steps

Pass USMLE exams and obtain the ECFMG Certificate.

Apply to Residency or Fellowship programs via The Match or directly.

Obtain official acceptance from an accredited program.

Receive Form DS-2019 from ECFMG.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee.

Complete the DS-160 form and pay the visa fee.

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy in Amman.

Attend the interview and submit documents.

Required Documents for the Interview

Completed visa application form DS-160.

Form DS-2019 issued by ECFMG.

Visa fee payment receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 fee payment receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid passport.

ECFMG Certificate + Acceptance letters from the medical program.

Costs and Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

ECFMG Fees: Vary depending on exams and services (may exceed USD 1,000).

Additional Costs:

Translation of certificates

Document shipping

Mandatory health insurance (USD 600â€“1,200 annually)

Costs and FeesThe Two-Year Home Country Requirement (212(e))

Most J-1 Physicians are subject to the requirement to return to their home country (such as Jordan) for two consecutive years after training ends. The physician cannot apply for work visas like H-1B or Permanent Residency (Green Card) until this requirement is met or a Waiver is obtained.

Common Waiver Options:

Conrad 30 Waiver Program (service in medically underserved areas in the U.S.).

No Objection Statement from the Jordanian Government.

Humanitarian hardship cases.

Benefits for Jordanian Physicians

Opportunity to train in top American hospitals.

Gaining advanced practical experience in medical specialties.

Enhancing the CV with prestigious international experience.

Potential to return to Jordan with high expertise or pursue a career path via a Waiver.

Start your global medical path with Kaya â€” Register now to accompany you from the USMLE exams to receiving your J-1 Physician visa and the start of your training in America.

files.U.S. Government Visitor Program (J-1 Vis:
U.S. Government Visitor Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

This program is administered by the U.S. Department of State under the umbrella of BridgeUSA. It focuses on government officials, political, and administrative leaders from outside the United States. It allows them to participate in official visits, meetings, and workshops with their American counterparts. The primary goal is to strengthen bilateral relations and exchange expertise in areas such as politics, administration, economics, security, education, and health.

Permitted Activities

Attending official meetings with American government officials.

Participating in workshops and seminars on public policy and administration.

Conducting field visits to American government institutions (ministries, parliaments, municipalities).

Interacting with American civil society to promote mutual understanding.

Essential Requirements

The candidate must be a government official, public servant, or influential political figure.

Nomination is typically done through the U.S. Embassy or the U.S. Department of State. Direct individual application is not possible.

Proficiency in the English language or the provision of an official interpreter.

A valid passport.

Application Steps (Nominated Individuals)

Nomination by the U.S. Embassy or Department of State.

Receive the official invitation letter.

Receive Form DS-2019.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee ($220 USD).

Complete the DS-160 form and pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy.

Attend the interview and submit documents.

Travel to the U.S. and participate in the program.

Required Documents

Visa Application Form (DS-160).

Form DS-2019 issued by the U.S. Department of State.

Visa Fee Receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 Fee Receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid Passport.

Official Invitation Letter from the U.S. Department of State.

Costs and Fees

Visa Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

Program Costs: Usually covered by the U.S. government (accommodation, domestic travel, activities).

Potential Additional Costs:

International airfare (sometimes covered by the invitation).

Personal expenses.

Program Objectives

Promoting mutual understanding between governments and peoples.

Exchanging expertise in public policy and administration.

Building long-term institutional relationships between the U.S. and other countries.

Enabling officials to learn about best American practices and implement them in their home countries.

Benefits for Participants

Opportunity for direct engagement with high-level U.S. government institutions.

Building a strong political and professional network.

Enhancing the CV with a prestigious diplomatic experience.

Rich cultural experience through interaction with American society.

What Kaya Offers You

Preparing your personal profile to be nomination-ready.

Crafting your CV and letters to reflect your leadership experience.

Training you for the consular interview to ensure you pass with confidence.

Guiding you during the program to maximize benefits from activities and networking.

With Kaya, turn your government experience into a bridge for international influence â€” Be part of the J-1 Government Visitor Program and start building a global network today.

files.U.S. Specialist Program (J-1 Visa).docx:
U.S. Specialist Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

This program allows international experts to share their specialized knowledge and skills with American institutions (universities, non-profit organizations, companies, museums, research centers). The primary goal is to enhance intellectual and professional exchange between foreign specialists and their American counterparts. Participants are not permitted to hold a permanent or long-term employment position in the United States.

Permitted Activities

Participation in specialized workshops or seminars.

Providing professional consultations to American organizations.

Presenting or conducting practical training in the field of specialization (e.g., media, environment, education, public administration, museums, sciences).

Collaborating with American experts to exchange best practices.

Program Duration

From 3 weeks up to 12 months maximum.

The program cannot be extended beyond one year.

Essential Requirements

The applicant must be an expert or specialist in a specific professional or knowledge field.

Must be invited by an accredited American institution.

Proficiency in English at a level that enables effective communication.

A valid passport.

The purpose must not be to fill a permanent position or seek long-term paid employment.

Application Steps

Obtain an official invitation from an American institution.

Receive Form DS-2019 from the sponsoring organization.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee ($220 USD).

Complete the DS-160 online application form.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy.

Attend the interview and submit documents.

Receive the visa and travel to the United States.

Required Documents

Visa Application Form (DS-160).

Form DS-2019 issued by the sponsoring organization.

Visa Fee Receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 Fee Receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid Passport.

Official Invitation/Acceptance Letter from the American institution.

Costs and Fees

Visa Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

Potential Additional Fees:

Document shipping

Translation or credential evaluation

Mandatory health insurance (may range between USD 600â€“1,200 annually)

Program Objectives

Enhancing cultural and professional exchange between international and American experts.

Transferring knowledge and modern techniques to American institutions.

Enriching international dialogue in specialized fields such as environment, media, education, health, and public administration.

Building long-term professional networks between experts and institutions.

Benefits for Participants

Opportunity for direct work with prestigious American institutions.

Enhancing the CV with specialized international experience.

Building a global professional network.

A rich cultural experience through residing in the United States.

What Kaya Offers You

Assisting you in preparing your professional file to reflect your specialized expertise.

Drafting your letters and CV to meet the requirements of American institutions.

Follow up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Training you for the consular interview to ensure you pass with confidence.

With Kaya, let your specialized expertise be your global passport â€” Enroll now in the J-1 Specialist program and share your experiences with the world from the heart of the United States.

files.U.S. Short-Term Scholar Program (J-1 Vis:
U.S. Short-Term Scholar Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

This program allows researchers and professors from outside the United States to participate in short-term academic activities. It is suitable for quick academic visits such as a semester lecture, a workshop, or a brief research project. The program cannot be extended beyond 6 months, and participants cannot change their category to a long-term Research Scholar.

Permitted Activities

Delivering lectures or teaching for a short academic term.

Participating in time-limited research projects.

Providing academic or professional consultations.

Participating in workshops or scientific seminars.

Training or demonstrating specialized skills at an academic or research institution.

Program Duration

Minimum: One day.

Maximum: 6 months.

No extensions are permitted after the duration limit.

Essential Requirements

The applicant must be a university professor, researcher, or expert in an academic or professional field.

Must obtain an official invitation from an accredited American university or institution.

The purpose must not be to fill a permanent or long-term employment position.

Proficiency in English at a level enabling academic communication.

A valid passport.

Application Steps

Obtain an invitation from an American academic or research institution.

Receive Form DS-2019 from the sponsoring organization.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee ($220 USD).

Complete the DS-160 online application form.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy.

Attend the interview and submit documents.

Travel to the United States and participate in the program.

Required Documents

Visa Application Form (DS-160).

Form DS-2019 issued by the sponsoring organization.

Visa Fee Receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 Fee Receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid Passport.

Official Invitation/Acceptance Letter from the American institution.

Costs and Fees

Visa Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

Potential Additional Fees:

Document translation

Paperwork shipping

Mandatory health insurance (USD 600â€“1,200 annually)

Program Objectives

Enhancing academic exchange between international and American researchers.

Enriching scientific research through short-term projects.

Exchanging expertise in education and research fields.

Building professional networks between academic institutions.

Benefits for Participants

Opportunity to collaborate with prestigious American universities and research centers.

Enhancing the CV with international academic experience.

Building a professional and academic network.

A rich cultural experience through residing in the United States.

What Kaya Offers You

Assisting you in professionally preparing your academic file.

Drafting your letters and CV to meet the requirements of American universities.

Following up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Training you for the consular interview to ensure you pass with confidence.

With Kaya, let your research reach the global stage â€” Enroll now in the J-1 Short-Term Scholar program and share your academic expertise from the heart of the United States.

files.U.S. Secondary School Student Program (J:
U.S. Secondary School Student Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

The Secondary School Student Program offers international students, including Jordanian students, a unique opportunity to study at an accredited American high school (public or private) for one semester or a full academic year. During this time, the student lives with an American host family or attends a boarding school, providing a comprehensive educational and cultural experience.

This program is designed to foster cultural exchange. It is not limited to academic study but also involves participation in school activities, sports, and community events, helping the student develop personal, linguistic, and cross-cultural skills.

 Host Family Experience

One of the defining features of the J-1 High School Student Program is the opportunity to live with an American host family. This experience is not just about accommodation; it grants the Jordanian student a real opportunity to integrate into American society and learn about its customs and traditions firsthand.

Safe and Supportive Environment: Host families are carefully selected by the sponsoring organization to ensure a suitable and safe environment for the student.

English Language Improvement: Daily communication with the family helps the student rapidly and naturally develop their language skills.

Comprehensive Cultural Experience: Participating in family activities like meals, trips, and social events gives the student a sense of belonging.

Building Long-Term Relationships: Many students maintain strong relationships with their host families even after the program ends.

For parents in Jordan, this experience provides their children with an exceptional educational and cultural opportunity, guaranteed by monitoring and supervision from the sponsoring organization and the host family.

 American High School Experience

Enrolling in a high school in the United States is more than just attending classes; it is a comprehensive journey that combines academic education, personal skill development, and integration into a diverse community.

Comprehensive and Diverse Curriculum: American high schools offer a mix of core subjects (Math, Science, English) alongside electives in Arts, Technology, Media, and Foreign Languages. This variety allows students to discover their interests and refine their talents.

Rich Extracurricular Activities: Sports (basketball, American football, swimming), Arts (theater, music, drawing), and community activities are essential parts of the experience, helping students build friendships and develop teamwork skills.

Interactive Learning Environment: American schools rely on classroom participation, practical projects, and group work, fostering critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.

Academic and Personal Support: Academic and psychological counselors are available to help students adapt to the new environment and achieve academic success.

Cultural Diversity: The presence of students from multiple backgrounds allows the Jordanian student to learn about different cultures while maintaining their identity and being open to others.

This experience is not just about studying; it is a foundational stage that opens doors to American and global universities for the Jordanian student, granting them greater self-confidence and adaptability for any future environment.

Eligibility Requirements

The student must be between 15 and 18.5 years old at the start of the program.

Must not have completed more than 11 years of schooling (excluding kindergarten).

Must not have previously participated in a high school exchange program in the US on a J-1 or F-1 visa.

Commitment to living with the host family or in the boarding school for the entire program duration.

Commitment to full-time enrollment at the American high school.

Key Benefits

Accredited American high school education, adding significant value to your academic path.

Mastery of the English language through daily study and integration with American society.

Rich cultural experience through living with a host family or in a boarding school environment.

Participation in extracurricular activities such as sports, arts, and community service.

Building an international network with students from around the world.

What is the J-1 Visa for Secondary Students?

It grants the student the right to study full-time at an accredited American high school.

The program duration is usually one academic year maximum (it cannot be extended).

Students are not permitted to work in the United States, except for very minor jobs like babysitting, with the host family's approval.

J-2 Visa for Dependents

Can be granted to a spouse or unmarried children under 21 if the high school student is accompanied by a guardian participating in another exchange program.

In the case of the Secondary School Student Program, the student usually travels alone and stays with a host family, so the J-2 visa is not commonly used here.

Application Steps

Apply through an approved sponsoring organization and obtain acceptance to an American high school.

Receive Form DS-2019 from the sponsoring organization.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee.

Complete the DS-160 online application form.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy in Amman.

Attend the personal interview and submit required documents.

Receive the visa and prepare for travel.

Required Documents for the Interview

Completed visa application form DS-160.

Visa fee payment receipt.

Form DS-2019 issued by the program sponsor.

SEVIS I-901 fee payment receipt.

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid passport for at least 6 months beyond the program's end date.

Student's current academic record (certificates and transcripts).

Unconditional supporting documents such as recommendation letters or proof of participation in school activities.

Costs and Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185 per applicant.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220 for the J1 student.

Program/Admission Fees: Vary depending on the sponsoring organization and school, usually ranging between USD 8,000 â€“ 15,000 per academic year (covering tuition, accommodation, and support services).

Potential Additional Costs:

Shipping admission documents via companies such as DHL, FedEx, or Aramex.

Translation or credential evaluation fees if required.

Personal expenses for the student (books, activities, monthly allowance).

All fees are non-refundable, even if the application is refused.

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultation to choose the most suitable program and school for you.

Professional preparation of your academic and financial file.

Follow-up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Training for the personal interview at the Embassy to increase acceptance chances.

Continuous support during the program to ensure a safe and successful experience.

Start your high school journey in the United States with Kaya â€” Register now to live an unforgettable educational and cultural experience and open the doors to your future.

files.U.S. Research Scholar Program (J-1 Visa):
U.S. Research Scholar Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

The Research Scholar Program is a segment of the U.S. BridgeUSA cultural exchange initiative, aiming to foster the exchange of ideas and knowledge between international researchers and American academic and research institutions. Through this program, Jordanian researchers can join accredited universities, research centers, or specialized institutions in the United States to conduct research, deliver lectures, or participate in joint scientific projects.

The program does not grant permanent residency but is a temporary opportunity, usually lasting up to 5 years maximum. It allows the scholar to enhance their expertise, build an academic network, and contribute to enriching scientific research.

Who Can Apply?

University faculty members in Jordan wishing to spend a research or teaching period in the U.S.

Researchers in scientific centers or research institutions.

Specialized academics with proven expertise in their field who wish to collaborate with American counterparts.

Permitted Activities

Conducting scientific research at universities or research centers.

Delivering lectures or participating in academic seminars.

Providing scientific consultations related to research projects.

Participating in joint projects between American and Jordanian institutions.

Essential Requirements

The researcher must not be a candidate for a permanent position (Tenure Track) in the U.S.

Must not have participated in the J-1 Research Scholar Program during the last 24 months.

Must not have resided in the U.S. on another J-1 program for more than 12 months preceding the current program start (with certain exceptions).

Obtain an official invitation or cooperation agreement from an accredited American institution.

A valid passport for the entire duration of the program.

Proof of financial ability to cover living expenses (if not fully funded by the host institution).



The Two-Year Home Country Physical Presence Requirement (212(e))

Some J-1 Research Scholar visa holders may be subject to the Two-Year Home Country Physical Presence Requirement, a legal obligation that mandates the researcher to return to their home country (such as Jordan) for two consecutive years after the program ends, before being eligible to apply for certain other U.S. visa types, such as:

H-1B (Specialty Occupation Work Visa).

L-1 (Intracompany Transferee Visa).

K (FiancÃ©(e) Visa).

Or applying for Permanent Residency (Green Card).

When Does This Requirement Apply?

If the program is funded by the U.S. Government or a foreign government (e.g., the Jordanian Government).

If the research field or specialization is listed on the Skills List deemed necessary for your country by the U.S. Department of State.

If the program is part of a bilateral international cooperation agreement between the U.S. and your home country.

Can the Requirement be Waived?

It is possible to apply for a Waiver of the two-year requirement in specific cases, such as:

Obtaining a No Objection Statement from the Jordanian Government.

Proving a risk to life or persecution if required to return.

Proving that the researcher's departure would cause hardship to a U.S. institution relying on their work.



Application Steps

Obtain an invitation or acceptance from an accredited American institution.

Receive Form DS-2019 from the sponsoring institution.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee.

Complete the DS-160 online application form.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy in Amman.

Attend the personal interview and submit the required documents.

Receive the visa and travel to the United States.

Required Documents for the Interview

Completed visa application form DS-160.

Form DS-2019 issued by the sponsoring organization.

Visa fee payment receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 fee payment receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid passport.

Official invitation or acceptance letter from the American institution.

Supporting documents such as CV, list of research publications, or research project plans.

Costs and Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

Potential Additional Fees:

Shipping documents.

Translation or credential evaluation.

Mandatory health insurance (may range between USD 600 â€“ 1,200 annually).

Important Note: All fees are non-refundable, even if the application is denied.

Benefits for Jordanian Researchers

Opportunity to work in an advanced research environment with state-of-the-art technologies.

Building an international academic network.

Enhancing the CV with American research experience.

Opportunity to participate in global conferences and seminars.

A rich cultural experience that promotes scientific and knowledge exchange.

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultation to choose the American institution best suited for your field.

Professional preparation of your academic and research file.

Follow-up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Training for the personal interview at the Embassy.

Additional support with travel and accommodation arrangements.

Start your research journey in the United States with Kaya â€” Register now and let us accompany you step-by-step from the academic invitation to receiving your J-1 visa.

files.U.S. Professor Program (J-1 Visa).docx:
U.S. Professor Program (J-1 Visa)

Overview

The J-1 Professor Program is part of the BridgeUSA cultural exchange programs overseen by the U.S. Department of State. This program aims to promote academic and intellectual exchange between American universities and their counterparts worldwide, including Jordanian and Arab universities. It allows professors to teach, lecture, participate in seminars, or conduct joint research in the United States for a temporary period, contributing to the transfer of knowledge and expertise between academic institutions.

Permitted Activities

Teaching university courses within the applicant's academic specialization.

Delivering public lectures or participating in scientific conferences.

Conducting collaborative scientific research with American researchers.

Providing academic consultations related to the specialized field.

Program Duration

Participation can extend up to a maximum of 5 years.

Transitioning to a permanent position (Tenure Track) in the United States is not permitted during the program.

Essential Requirements

The applicant must be a university professor or academic with proven experience in teaching or research.

Must not have participated in the J-1 Professor or Research Scholar program during the last 24 months.

Must not have resided in the U.S. on another J-1 program for more than 12 months preceding the current program start (with certain exceptions).

Obtain an official invitation or cooperation agreement from an accredited American university or institution.

A valid passport for the entire duration of the program.

Proof of financial ability to cover living expenses if not fully funded by the host institution.

Application Steps

Obtain an invitation or acceptance from an American university or institution.

Receive Form DS-2019 from the sponsoring organization.

Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee.

Complete the DS-160 online application form.

Pay the visa fee ($185 USD).

Book an appointment at the U.S. Embassy.

Attend the personal interview and submit the required documents.

Receive the visa and travel to the United States.

Required Documents for the Interview

Completed visa application form DS-160.

Form DS-2019 issued by the sponsoring organization.

Visa fee payment receipt ($185 USD).

SEVIS I-901 fee payment receipt ($220 USD).

Recent personal photo (5x5 cm, white background).

Valid passport.

Official invitation or acceptance letter from the American institution.

Academic Curriculum Vitae (CV) and a list of research or publications.

Costs and Fees

Visa Application Fee: USD 185.

SEVIS I-901 Fee: USD 220.

Potential Additional Fees:

Document shipping.

Translation or credential evaluation.

Mandatory health insurance (may range between USD 600 â€“ 1,200 annually).

Important Note: All fees are non-refundable, even if the application is denied.

The Two-Year Home Country Requirement (212(e))

Some participating professors may be subject to the requirement to return to their home country for two consecutive years after the program ends, especially if the funding is governmental or if the specialization is on the Skills List. A Waiver can be requested in special cases, such as obtaining a No Objection Statement from the Jordanian Government or proving potential hardship if required to return.

Benefits for Jordanian Professors

Opportunity to teach at prestigious American universities.

Building an international academic network.

Enhancing the CV with American teaching or research experience.

Participation in global conferences and seminars.

A rich cultural experience that promotes scientific and knowledge exchange.

What Kaya Offers You

Specialized consultation to choose the most suitable American university or institution.

Professional preparation of your academic and research file.

Follow-up on all application steps until the visa is issued.

Training for the personal interview at the Embassy.

Start your academic journey in the United States with Kaya â€” Register now and let us accompany you step-by-step from the university invitation to receiving your J-1 Professor visa.
