files.Spain Student Visa.docx:
Spain Student Visa

Spain is not merely a country for study; it is a life experience. A language alive with music, cities that breathe art, and reasonable living costs that give you space to discover yourself and confidently build your future.

Why Spain?

Global Language: Studying Spanish in its native environment opens doors to work in Europe, Latin America, and the Middle East.

Balanced Cost of Living: Lower compared to Western European countries, with a high quality of life and diverse housing options.

Rich Student Life: Festivals, museums, football, and continuous cultural scenesâ€”you will live your education outside the classroom as well as inside.

Historic Universities & Modern Programs: From Business and Tourism to Arts and Technology, you will find flexible and practical programs.

Legal Part-Time Work Opportunities: Regulations allow working during studies within specific limits, supporting you financially and enhancing your experience.

Available Programs

Language Institutes: Intensive and general courses, DELE exam preparation, and cultural integration programs.

Universities: Bachelor's and Master's tracks in both Spanish and English, along with exchange and practical training programs.

Estimated Costs

Annual Tuition Fees: EUR 5,000â€“12,000 depending on the program and university

Monthly Living Expenses: EUR 600â€“900 (housing, transportation, food, basic health insurance)

Note: Costs vary depending on the city and type of accommodation. Barcelona and Madrid are slightly higher, while Valencia and Granada are more balanced.

Most In-Demand Majors

Tourism and Hospitality: A major tourist country with strong practical application opportunities.

Arts and Design: Established schools and a contemporary cultural scene.

Business Management: An environment for entrepreneurship, startups, and diverse training opportunities.

Data Science and Digital Marketing: Modern programs connected to the European job market.

Application Steps for the Spain Student Visa

Phase 1: Academic Acceptance

Choose the Program and Institution: Language or University, and verify the language of instruction and requirements.

Submit the Admission Application: CV, certificates, language proof (if applicable), and a motivation letter.

Obtain the Official Acceptance Letter: Includes program details, duration, and study hours.

Phase 2: Visa File Preparation

Visa Application Form: Complete the form approved by the Spanish Consulate in your country.

Valid Passport: Valid for at least the program duration plus six months, with recent photos.

Acceptance Letter: From an accredited educational institution in Spain.

Proof of Financial Means: Recent bank statement or financial sponsorship covering living and tuition fees.

Comprehensive Health Insurance: Must cover the entire duration of stay in Spain.

Police Clearance Certificate: Authenticated according to Consulate requirements.

Medical Certificate: Stating freedom from diseases requiring quarantine, as per regulations.

Proof of Accommodation in Spain: Preliminary housing contract or a letter from the institution confirming accommodation.

Preliminary Travel Plan: Without the need to purchase final tickets before visa issuance.

Translation and Authentication: Translation of documents into Spanish or English, and authentication if required.

Phase 3: Submission and Follow-up

Book a Consulate Appointment: To submit the file and provide biometrics, if required.

Pay Consular Fees: According to local currency and Consulate instructions (typically â‚¬60â€“â‚¬80).

Interview (If Requested): To explain your study plan, financial support, and accommodation.

Await the Decision: Usually 4 to 8 weeks, depending on the season and volume of applications.

Required Documents

Passport and Personal Photos

Valid passport covering the study period + 6 additional months

Copies of main pages (data and previous visas)

Recent personal photos with white background, compliant with EU visa standards

Academic Admission Letter

Official admission letter from a recognized university or language institute in Spain

Must specify: program name, duration, weekly hours (minimum 20 for language), and start date

Proof of Financial Means

Recent bank statement (last 3â€“6 months) in the name of the student or guardian

Or financial sponsorship letter from guardian/sponsor with proof of income

Required amount usually covers EUR 600â€“700 per month + tuition fees

Health Insurance

Comprehensive health insurance covering the entire stay in Spain

Must include: emergencies, medical treatment, and repatriation if needed

Police Clearance Certificate

Issued from the country of residence or any country where the student lived for more than 6 months in the past 5 years

Must be certified and translated into Spanish

Medical Certificate

Medical report proving absence of contagious or serious diseases

Must be issued within the last 3 months before application

Proof of Accommodation in Spain

Rental contract, or letter from the university/institute confirming student housing

Preliminary booking in student housing or hotel may be accepted at the time of application

Visa Application Form

Completed National Visa Application Form for Spain

Signed by the student (or guardian if underage)

Travel Plan

Preliminary flight booking (not mandatory to purchase before visa approval)

Preferably attach a timeline for arrival and study

Visa Fee

Payment of consular fees (varies by country of application, usually EUR 60â€“80)

Payment receipt must be attached to the file

Consular Visa Fee

Amount: Usually ranges between EUR 60â€“80, with slight variations depending on the country of application or visa type.

Purpose: This fee covers the processing costs by the consulate (document review, data entry, decision issuance).

Difference from Tuition Fees: The consular fee is unrelated to the university or study program; it applies solely to immigration procedures.

Payment Receipt: A payment receipt must be attached to the visa application file as proof that the required fee has been paid.

Meaning of â€œApplication Feeâ€

Definition: It is the same as the consular fee, i.e., the amount paid to the embassy/consulate when submitting the visa application.

Reason for the Name: It is called the â€œapplication feeâ€ because it is paid upon submission and is non-refundable, whether the application is approved or rejected.

Difference from Other Fees:

Tuition Fees: Paid to the university or institute

Living Expenses: Proven through a bank statement or financial guarantee

Health Insurance: Must have a valid policy covering the entire stay

âš ï¸ Important Notes

Some consulates may require payment in cash (in euros), while others accept card or bank transfer.

Fees may vary slightly depending on the country of application, so it is best to check the Spanish consulateâ€™s website in your country before applying.

Fees are non-refundable if the application is rejected.

Additional Notes

Translation and Legalization: All non-Spanish documents must be translated into Spanish (or sometimes English) and legalized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Spanish consulate.

Processing Time: Applications usually take 4â€“8 weeks to process, so early submission is recommended.

After Arrival: Students must obtain a residence card (TIE) within 30 days of entering Spain.

Tip: Keep both paper and digital copies of all documents, organized according to the application sequence, to speed up processing.

Work During and After Study

Part-Time Work During Study: Allowed within specified weekly hour limits. Often requires an employment contract and a permit linked to your program.

Post-Graduation: You can apply to change your status to residency for job searching or entrepreneurship, granting you legal time to explore opportunities.

With Kaya: Your Path to Spain is Easier

Personalized Program Guidance: We match your goals with the best institutes and universities.

Flawless Visa File Preparation: We review, translate, and coordinate authentications.

Accommodation and Arrival Coordination: From preliminary booking to opening your local bank account.

Post-Arrival Support: TIE procedures, municipal registration, and initial part-time job opportunities.

Kaya: Every country is a new opportunity for a rich educational and life experience. We accompany you step-by-step until you reach your dream. Shall we plan Spain together?

files.Study Visas_.docx:
Study Visas with Kaya

Your Academic Journey Starts Here

At Kaya, we believe that studying abroad is not just about academics; it is a holistic life experience that opens the doors to your future. We assist you in obtaining student visas for a range of top global destinations, providing meticulous follow-up on every detail, from the moment you select your program until you arrive at your desk.

Our Study Visa Services

We offer all educational options that suit your goals:

Language Institutes (ESL): To develop your language skills in a native-speaking environment.

Diploma: Specialized vocational programs that open the doors to the job market.

Bachelor's Degree: Comprehensive university study at the world's best universities.

Master's Degree: Advanced academic programs that qualify you for leadership and scientific research.

The "Conditional Admission" Advantage

The "Conditional Admission" feature is available in several global study destinations, including:

USA

Canada

UK

Australia

Germany (via preparatory year or language programs)

Spain (in some universities offering programs in English)

This option grants you university acceptance conditional upon first completing an English language program or a preparatory year, which provides you with:

Greater flexibility to start your academic journey even if you haven't met the language requirement yet.

Increased chances of admission to prestigious universities.

A seamless transition from language study to your academic major without the need to reapply.

In brief: Conditional Admission is a smart bridge between you and your university dream, especially if you need to strengthen your language before starting your specialization.

Study Destinations Available Through Kaya

U.S. Student Visa

Language study, Bachelorâ€™s, Masterâ€™s

CPT (practical training during study) and OPT (work opportunity after graduation)

Wide range of majors: Engineering, Business Administration, IT, Medicine

Rich and diverse campus life 

ğŸ”— More about U.S. Visa

Canadian Student Visa

World-class education system with lower tuition compared to the U.S.

Ability to work part-time while studying

Conditional admission programs available

Strong fields in AI, Nursing, Business Administration

Post-graduation: PGWP (Post-Graduation Work Permit) leading to permanent residency 

ğŸ”— More about Canadian Visa

UK Student Visa

Focused, shorter academic programs (Bachelorâ€™s in 3 years)

Conditional study options via university-affiliated language institutes

Distinguished majors: Law, Media, Humanities, Medicine

Post-graduation: 2-year work visa (Graduate Route) 

ğŸ”— More about UK Visa

Australian Student Visa

Multicultural environment, popular among Gulf students

Ability to work 20 hours per week during study

Strong majors: Engineering, Agriculture, Marine Sciences, Business Administration

Post-graduation: Temporary Graduate Visa 

ğŸ”— More about Australian Visa

German Student Visa

Low or nearly free tuition at public universities

Strength in Engineering, Mechanics, Medicine

Study options in English or German

Wide job opportunities after graduation in a strong industrial market 

ğŸ”— More about German Visa

Spanish Student Visa

Ideal destination for learning Spanish

Distinguished majors: Tourism, Arts, Business Administration

Lower living costs compared to Western Europe

Rich cultural experience and vibrant student life 

ğŸ”— More about Spanish Visa

Why Choose Kaya?

Extensive Experience in issuing study visas.

Personalized Follow-up on your file, step-by-step.

Partnerships with globally accredited universities and institutes.

Full Support before, during, and after travel.

With Kaya, your study abroad is not a distant dream, but a clear plan that starts here.

files.US Visas.docx:
US Visas

Overview

The United States of America, located in the Western Hemisphere, is the largest economic and military power in the world, distinguished by its geographical and cultural diversity. Its area spans about $9.8$ million square kilometers, making it the third-largest country in the world by area, with a population of over 331 million.

The United States is located in North America, between the Atlantic Ocean to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west, sharing borders with Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. It boasts immense natural diversity, including the towering Rocky Mountains, the fertile Great Plains, the arid Nevada desert, and long coastlines on both the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. The country's highest peak is Denali in Alaska, with an elevation of $6,190$ meters.

History and Government

The lands of the United States have been inhabited by indigenous peoples for thousands of years. In 1492, Europeans began arriving on the continent, and the first British colonies were established in the 17th century. In 1776, the colonies declared their independence from Britain, establishing the United States as a new nation.

The 19th century witnessed significant westward expansion and conflicts such as the Civil War (1861â€“1865), which ended slavery. In the 20th century, the US emerged as a superpower after the two World Wars and became a major player in global politics and economy.

The United States is a federal democratic republic composed of 50 states plus the federal capital, Washington, D.C. The system of government is based on the separation of powers: the Presidency, the Congress, and the Supreme Court. Its official motto is: In God We Trust, and its traditional motto is: E Pluribus Unum (Out of Many, One).

Economy and Global Cities

The US possesses the world's largest economy, based on technology, industry, agriculture, and financial services. It is a member of major international organizations such as the United Nations, the G20, and the World Trade Organization.

It is famous for its global cities such as:

New York: A global financial and cultural center.

Los Angeles: The capital of cinema and entertainment.

Chicago: A major industrial and commercial hub.

Main States

California: Capital Sacramento, home to Los Angeles, the center of the film industry.

New York: Capital Albany, home to New York City, the country's largest city.

Texas: Capital Austin, known for its vast area and energy industries.

Florida: Capital Tallahassee, famous for its beaches and tourist centers like Miami and Orlando.

Illinois: Capital Springfield, home to Chicago, the third-largest US city.

Alaska: The largest state by area, capital Juneau, known for its wild nature.

Hawaii: An island state in the Pacific Ocean, capital Honolulu, famous for its natural beauty.



Why Choose America for Tourism or Visit?

A global destination including famous cities like New York, Los Angeles, and Orlando.

Unparalleled cultural diversity and tourist experiences.

Opportunities to visit relatives or attend international events.

What Makes America Unique

Geographic Diversity: From the beaches of Florida to the mountains of California and the deserts of Nevada.

Global Cities: New York, Los Angeles, Miami, and Las Vegas are among the worldâ€™s most famous cities.

Culture and Arts: Home to Hollywood, Broadway, and world-class museums.

Economy and Shopping: A destination for shopping enthusiasts, offering global luxury brands.

Natural Beauty: Includes national parks such as the Grand Canyon and Yellowstone.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa (B-2)

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, shopping, attending events.

Duration of Stay: Up to 6 months.

Required Documents: Valid passport, recent personal photo, bank statement proving financial capacity, hotel reservation or travel itinerary.

Features: Possibility of visa extension in some cases.

2. Visit Visa (B-2 â€“ Family Visit)

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in the US.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the resident in the US, proof of relationship (birth certificate, marriage contract...), proof of financial ability to cover the trip.

Features: Gives you the opportunity to spend time with family in a safe environment.

3. Transit Visa (C-1)

Purpose: Passing through the US during your journey to another country.

Duration of Stay: Typically 24 â€“ 48 hours.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, visa for the final destination (if required).

Features: Facilitates international connecting flights through US airports.

Costs

Tourist/Visit Visa Fee: Approximately $185 USD.

Transit Visa Fee: Approximately $185 USD.

Service or appointment fees may be added depending on the embassy.

Processing Time

Appointment Booking: Each US Embassy or Consulate has a different appointment schedule. In some countries, you may get an appointment within two weeks, while in others, you might wait several months. (Official wait times can be checked via the US Department of State's Visa Wait Times website).

After the Interview: If approved, the visa is typically processed and the passport is mailed within an average of 3â€“5 weeks. In some cases, it may be faster (a few days) or longer if additional administrative processing is required.

Top Tourist Attractions in the United States

Statue of Liberty â€“ New York Symbol of freedom and democracy, gifted by France in 1886. Located in New York Harbor, it is one of the worldâ€™s most famous landmarks.

Central Park â€“ New York The largest urban park in New York, covering 3.4 kmÂ². Features lakes, gardens, and a zoo, serving as a natural retreat in the city.

Times Square â€“ New York The vibrant heart of New York, famous for its giant screens and Broadway shows. Known as â€œthe square that never sleeps.â€

Disney World â€“ Florida The largest entertainment resort in the world, with four main theme parks. An ideal destination for families and children.

Universal Studios â€“ California An entertainment and film city in Los Angeles. Offers behind-the-scenes tours of Hollywood and rides inspired by movies.

Golden Gate Bridge â€“ San Francisco, California A famous suspension bridge opened in 1937. Considered one of the most beautiful bridges in the world, overlooking San Francisco Bay.

Las Vegas Strip â€“ Nevada A main street featuring world-famous casinos and luxury hotels. Renowned for dazzling entertainment shows and vibrant nightlife.

Grand Canyon â€“ Arizona (near Nevada) A massive canyon stretching 446 km. One of natureâ€™s wonders, attracting millions of tourists annually.

Atlantic City â€“ New Jersey A coastal city famous for its casinos and boardwalk. A popular summer destination on the East Coast.



The United States of America is a country with a long history, a strong federal system, and a leading global economy. It combines cultural and geographical diversity, making it one of the most influential nations in the world.

With Kaya, obtaining a US visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.Canada Visas.docx:
Canada Visas

Overview

Canada is considered one of the largest and most beautiful countries in the world, located in the northern part of North America, distinguished by a unique blend of stunning nature and modern cities. Canada spans vast areas, including the towering Rocky Mountains, beautiful coastlines on the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, and extensive forests.

Canada has a rich and complex history dating back thousands of years with Indigenous Peoples inhabiting its lands before the arrival of European explorers. European exploration began in the 15th century when explorer John Cabot reached the Atlantic coasts of Canada. This was followed by the settlement of the French and English, who competed for control of the territories.

In 1867, Canada became a sovereign nation within the British Commonwealth after the establishment of the Confederation. Over time, Canada developed into one of the most prosperous and advanced countries globally.

Canadian Provinces and Territories 

Canada consists of 10 provinces and 3 territories, each with its own unique culture and nature:

Western Provinces:

British Columbia: Famous for its natural beauty and vibrant cities such as Vancouver.

Alberta: Home to the Rocky Mountains and Banff National Park.

Saskatchewan: Vast agricultural lands and natural prairies.

Manitoba: An ideal destination for nature and wildlife enthusiasts.

Central Provinces:

Ontario: Includes the national capital Ottawa and the largest city Toronto.

Quebec: Known for its French culture and the beautiful city of Montreal.

Atlantic Provinces:

New Brunswick: A mix of mountains and beautiful coastlines.

Nova Scotia: Renowned for its stunning maritime scenery.

Prince Edward Island: A charming destination with sandy beaches.

Newfoundland and Labrador: A destination for lovers of natural adventures.

Northern Territories:

Yukon: Spectacular landscapes and a unique experience of the Northern Lights.

Northwest Territories: Home to vast stretches of wilderness.

Nunavut: Land of ice and Inuit culture.

Why Choose Canada for Tourism or Visit?

Stunning Nature: Niagara Falls, the Rocky Mountains, and the lakes of Vancouver.

Global Cities: Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver.

Safe and Multicultural Environment: Suitable for families and visitors from the Gulf and the Arab world.

What Distinguishes Canada

Vast Area: The second-largest country globally, surrounded by three oceans (Atlantic, Pacific, and Arctic).

Natural Diversity: Mountains, rivers, glacial lakes, and some of the world's most beautiful waterfalls.

Modern Cities: Toronto, Vancouver, and Montreal offer a blend of global culture and modernity.

Multicultural Society: Canada welcomes millions of immigrants and international students, making it an open and diverse environment.

Safety and Quality: Known as one of the safest countries with a high standard of living.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa (Visitor Visa)

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, attending events, or spending a holiday.

Duration of Stay: Up to 6 months.

Required Documents: Valid passport, recent personal photo, bank statement proving financial capacity, hotel reservation or travel itinerary, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Possibility of Multiple Entry for up to 10 years, flexibility in moving between Canadian cities.

2. Family or Business Visit Visa

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends, or attending business meetings.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the host (individual or company), proof of relationship (birth certificate, marriage contract, or business document), proof of the host's residence, bank statement for the host or the visitor.

Features: Allows spending time with family or developing business relationships, same duration of stay (up to 6 months).

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through Canada during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: Up to 48 hours.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, visa for the final destination (if required).

Features: Often free, facilitates international connecting flights through Canadian airports.

Costs

1. Tourist/Visit Visa (Visitor Visa)

Basic Fees: $100 CAD per person.

The visa can be single or multiple entry, often granted for validity up to 10 years or until the passport expires.

2. Transit Visa

Fee: Free in most cases, granted to travelers transiting through Canada on their way to another country, provided the stay does not exceed 48 hours.

3. Biometrics

Fee: $85 CAD per person (includes fingerprinting and a digital photo).

Exemptions: If the applicant provided biometrics within the last 10 years, they do not need to re-submit or pay the fee again. Certain age groups are exempt (e.g., children under 14 and seniors over 79).

Processing Time

Typically between 3 weeks to 3 months.

It is recommended to apply well in advance of the travel date (at least two months).

Top Tourist Attractions in Canada

Whistler Mountain â€“ British Columbia Located in British Columbia, about two hours by car from Vancouver. One of the worldâ€™s most famous ski destinations, host of the 2010 Winter Olympics. Activities:

World-class ski slopes in winter

Peak 2 Peak Gondola connecting Whistler and Blackcomb, offering breathtaking views of forests and mountains

Hiking and mountain biking in summer

CN Tower â€“ Toronto Part of the CN Tower experience, visitors can enjoy special tours and night shows. One of Torontoâ€™s most iconic landmarks and among the tallest towers in the world.

Niagara Falls One of the most famous waterfalls in the world, located on the border between Canada and the U.S. Water drops from over 50 meters with an impressive flow. Boat tours such as Maid of the Mist allow visitors to see the falls up close.

Banff National Park â€“ Alberta Located in the Rocky Mountains. Famous for turquoise lakes such as Lake Louise and Moraine Lake. Offers year-round activities: skiing in winter, hiking in summer.

Big Heart â€“ Toronto An artistic landmark reflecting Torontoâ€™s creative spirit. A perfect spot for art lovers and local culture. Not just a sculpture, but a social and artistic experience showcasing the warmth and diversity of Toronto.

Princesâ€™ Gates â€“ Toronto Historic gate built in 1927. An architectural symbol serving as the main entrance to the Canadian National Exhibition. Combines architectural grandeur with national symbolism, making it a major tourist attraction.

Jasper National Park â€“ Alberta The largest national park in the Canadian Rockies. Features glaciers, hot springs, and diverse wildlife. An ideal stargazing site, recognized as one of the worldâ€™s largest dark-sky preserves.

Old Quebec City â€“ Quebec A historic city listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Known for cobblestone streets and classic European architecture. Includes the Citadel and Place Royale.

Prince Edward Island Canadaâ€™s smallest province and one of the most picturesque. Famous for red sandy beaches, historic lighthouses, and green farmland. Inspired by the famous novel Anne of Green Gables.

If you are planning to visit Canada for any purpose, you will find it a country rich with opportunities and fulfilling experiences for everyone.

With Kaya, obtaining a Canada visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.United Kingdom Visas.docx:
United Kingdom Visas

Overview

The United Kingdom (UK) is one of the most prominent European nations, comprising four main constituent countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. The country is distinguished by its ancient history and rich culture, and its capital, London, is one of the world's most important centers for finance, business, and culture.

Evolution of the United Kingdom Through History

1707 â€“ Union of England and Scotland: Under the Act of Union, the two kingdoms merged to form the Kingdom of Great Britain.

1801 â€“ Union of Great Britain with Ireland: The Act of Union 1800 was enacted, and the state became known as the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

1922 â€“ Partition of Ireland: After years of political conflict and uprisings, the Anglo-Irish Treaty was signed, leading to the division of the island:

Southern Ireland (Irish Free State): Gained independence and later became the Republic of Ireland in 1949.

Northern Ireland: Remained part of the United Kingdom and continues to be one of its four constituent countries.

1927 â€“ Official Name Change: The stateâ€™s official name became the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

The UK has undergone many transformations throughout its history, from being a major colonial power during the British Empire, which controlled vast parts of the world, to becoming a modern nation dealing with challenges like the World Wars, the post-colonial era, and joining and then leaving the European Union in 2016 via the "Brexit" referendum. This eventful history reflects a continuous interaction between social change, the Industrial Revolution, and major political events that shaped the UK's identity as we know it today.

Constituent Countries of the UK:

England â€“ The largest in terms of population and area.

Scotland â€“ Known for its distinct history and culture.

Wales â€“ Distinguished by its own language and Celtic heritage.

Northern Ireland â€“ Remains part of the union after the separation of the South.

Why Choose Britain for Tourism or Visit?

Home to prestigious universities like Cambridge and Oxford, along with famous historical landmarks such as the Tower of London and Buckingham Palace.

Vibrant cities like London, Manchester, and Edinburgh.

A preferred destination for visitors from the Gulf and the Arab world due to easy accessibility and frequent flights.

What Makes Britain Unique

Rich History: A kingdom spanning centuries, filled with castles, palaces, and historic landmarks.

Culture and Arts: Home of English literature, Shakespearean theatre, and world-class museums.

Geographic Diversity: From the green countryside of the Cotswolds to the Scottish Highlands and Loch Ness.

Global Cities: London, Manchester, Edinburgh, and Liverpoolâ€”each with its own distinctive charm attracting visitors.

Blend of Old and New: Modern skyscrapers stand alongside historic buildings that are hundreds of years old.

Types of Visas

1. Standard Visitor Visa (Tourism and Short Visit)

Purpose: Tourism, shopping, attending events, or a short visit.

Duration of Stay: Up to 6 months.

Features: Allows visiting multiple British cities, flexible activities (tourism, short conferences, short-term medical treatment).

2. Family Visit Visa

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in Britain.

Features: Allows spending time with family, same duration of stay (up to 6 months).

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through UK airports during your journey to another destination.

Types:

Direct Airside Transit Visa (DATV): To stay only in the airport without entering the UK.

Visitor in Transit Visa: If you need to leave the airport for a short period.

Duration of Stay: 24 â€“ 48 hours.

Types of Visitor and Tourist Visas and Official Fees

Short-term Visit Visa (6 months): USD 174

Long-term Visit Visa (2 years): USD 650

Long-term Visit Visa (5 years): USD 1,161

Long-term Visit Visa (10 years): USD 1,450

Note: All of these visas allow a maximum stay of up to 6 months per visit, even if the visa validity is longe

Transit Visa Fees: Direct Airside Transit Visa: Â£35. Visitor in Transit Visa: Â£64.

Fast-Track Processing Options

Standard Processing: Usually takes about 3 weeks from the date of application submission.

Priority Processing: Decision within 5 working days for an additional fee (approx. GBP 500).

Super Priority Processing: Decision within 1 working day for an additional fee (approx. GBP 1,000).

Standard Processing Time: 

Usually between 3 â€“ 6 weeks. It is recommended to apply well in advance (at least two months) of the travel date.

Important Tips

You must prove your intention to return to your home country (job, study, property).

All documents must be translated into English when necessary.

In the case of a family visit, the clearer the invitation letter, the higher the chances of acceptance.

Top Tourist Attractions in Britain

Tower of London A historic castle on the banks of the River Thames. Once a royal residence and prison, today it houses the Crown Jewels.

Big Ben & Palace of Westminster A political and historical symbol of London. Home to the British Parliament with the iconic clock tower.

Buckingham Palace The official residence of the King/Queen. Famous for the Changing of the Guard ceremony held in front of the palace.

British Museum One of the largest museums in the world. Holds artifacts from various civilizations, including the Rosetta Stone and Egyptian antiquities.

Stonehenge A prehistoric stone monument. One of the most mysterious archaeological sites in the world.

Roman Baths â€“ Bath A historic city known for its ancient Roman baths and Georgian architecture. Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

York Minster One of the largest Gothic cathedrals in Europe. A religious and historical landmark in northern England.

London Eye A giant Ferris wheel on the banks of the River Thames, offering stunning panoramic views of London. One of Britainâ€™s most visited attractions since its opening in 2000.

Edinburgh Castle Located on a high hill in Scotlandâ€™s capital, Edinburgh. One of Europeâ€™s most important historic castles, featuring museums and exhibitions on Scottish history, with spectacular city views.

Whether you plan to visit the UK to enjoy the sights or explore its rich culture, proper planning and obtaining the right visa through Kaya will contribute to making your experience wonderful and distinctive.

With Kaya, obtaining a UK visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.Australia Visas.docx:
Australia Visas

Overview

Australia is a country located in the Southern Hemisphere, an island continent situated between the Indian and Pacific Oceans. Australia is the sixth-largest country in the world by area, characterized by its diverse climate, ranging from vast deserts in the interior to bustling coastlines and famous sandy beaches. Australia is composed of six states and three main territories.

Australia's history is long and complex, having been home to many Indigenous Peoples before its discovery by Europeans. In 1770, Captain James Cook arrived in Australia, and Britain subsequently began establishing colonies on Australian lands. Sydney was founded as a British colony in 1788, and the country experienced rapid growth and cultural and social development during the 19th century. In 1901, Australia became a sovereign federal state after the British colonies united in the Australian Federation.

Today, Australia is a democratic and independent nation with a strong and advanced economy. It maintains close relations with many countries worldwide and is a member of major international organizations such as the United Nations, the G20, and the World Trade Organization.

States in Australia

New South Wales: Capital Sydney, Australiaâ€™s largest city, an important cultural and commercial hub.

Queensland: Capital Brisbane, famous for tropical beaches and national parks.

South Australia: Capital Adelaide, renowned for arts and music.

Tasmania: An island south of the mainland, known for diverse natural beauty.

Victoria: Capital Melbourne, a major center for culture and arts.

Western Australia: Capital Perth, the largest state by area, known for its beautiful beaches.

Territories

Mainland Territories:

Australian Capital Territory (ACT): Includes Canberra, the federal capital.

Northern Territory: Famous for deserts and natural landmarks such as Uluru.

External Territories:

Norfolk Island

Cocos Islands

Christmas Island

Ashmore and Cartier Islands â€“ uninhabited

Heard and McDonald Islands â€“ uninhabited

Australian Antarctic Territory â€“ the largest territory by area

Coral Sea Islands â€“ uninhabited

Why Choose Australia for Tourism or Visit?

Stunning Nature: The Great Barrier Reef, golden beaches, and national parks.

Global Cities: Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane.

Multicultural Environment: Safe and welcoming to visitors from the Gulf and the Arab world.

What Makes Australia Unique

Natural Diversity: From golden beaches to rainforests and national parks.

Global Cities: Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane combine modernity with culture.

Multicultural Society: Australia welcomes millions of migrants and students, creating an open and diverse environment.

Tourism Activities: From bridge climbing to surfing and exploring wildlife.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa (Visitor Visa â€“ Subclass 600)

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, spending a holiday, or attending events.

Duration of Stay: From 3 months up to 12 months (depending on the visa stream).

Features: Possibility of single or multiple entry, flexibility in choosing the duration of stay.

2. Family Visit Visa

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in Australia.

Features: Gives you the opportunity to spend time with family, same duration of stay (3â€“12 months).

3. Transit Visa (Subclass 771)

Purpose: Passing through Australia during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: Up to 72 hours.

Features: Often free, facilitates international connecting flights through Australian airports.

Costs

Visitor Visa Subclass 600 (Tourism or Visit):

Basic Fee: $190 AUD when applying online.

Costs may vary depending on the type of visit (tourism, short business, family visit).

Transit Visa Subclass 771:

Fee: Free. Granted for travelers transiting through Australia on their way to another country, provided the stay does not exceed 72 hours.

Processing Time

Typically between 3 â€“ 6 weeks.

It is advisable to apply well in advance of the travel date (at least two months).

Important Tips

You must prove your intention to return to your home country (job, study, property).

Documents must be translated into English when necessary.

In the case of a family visit, the clearer the invitation letter, the higher the chances of acceptance.

Top Tourist Attractions in Australia

Sydney Opera House A world-famous architectural icon listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A performing arts center hosting opera, theatre, dance, and concerts. Visitors can join guided tours to learn about its history and unique design.

Sydney Harbour Bridge A massive steel bridge opened in 1932, one of Sydneyâ€™s most iconic landmarks. Offers a unique experience of bridge climbing to reach a panoramic viewing platform overlooking the harbour and Opera House. Locally nicknamed â€œCoathangerâ€ due to its arch shape.

Manly Beach â€“ Sydney One of Sydneyâ€™s most popular beaches, perfect for swimming and surfing. Known for its relaxed atmosphere and coastal promenade filled with restaurants and cafÃ©s. Easily accessible via ferry from Circular Quay.

Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha The largest botanical garden in Brisbane, located at the foot of Mt Coot-tha. Features a vast collection of native and international plants, including Japanese and tropical gardens. A great destination for nature lovers and photographers, with stunning city views from the mountain summit.

Australian Beaches: Bondi Beach (Sydney) and Juno Beach (Queensland) offer excellent leisure and relaxation experiences.

Great Barrier Reef â€“ Queensland One of the worldâ€™s natural wonders and the largest coral reef system globally. Located off the coast of Queensland, it is a paradise for diving and snorkeling.

Alice Springs â€“ Northern Territory Located in the heart of Australia, a gateway to Uluru (Ayers Rock), one of the countryâ€™s most iconic natural landmarks.

Melbourne â€“ Victoria A cultural and sporting city, famous for museums, trendy restaurants, and as a hub for art and design.

Tasmania National Parks Protected natural areas with rainforests, rivers, and mountains, making Tasmania one of Australiaâ€™s most scenic destinations.

Snowy Mountains â€“ New South Wales A prime destination for skiing and winter sports enthusiasts.

Blue Mountains â€“ New South Wales A stunning natural region west of Sydney, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Famous for rock formations such as the Three Sisters and eucalyptus forests. Activities include hiking, cable car rides, and cave exploration. Unique experience: witnessing the blue haze caused by evaporating eucalyptus oils.

Kings Park â€“ Perth, Western Australia One of the largest urban parks in the world, located in central Perth. Features a rich botanical garden of native Australian plants, walking and cycling trails. Offers panoramic views of the Swan River and Perth skyline. A perfect spot for leisure, photography, and cultural events.

Australia offers a diverse tourism experience, combining sophisticated urban life with breathtaking natural landscapes, making it one of the world's top tourist destinations.

With Kaya, obtaining an Australia visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.Mexico Visas.docx:
Mexico Visas

Overview

Mexico's civilization spans over $3,000$ years, where great civilizations like the Maya and Aztecs originated, leaving astonishing ruins in temples and pyramids. The country has witnessed major developments in arts, music, and cuisine, and today, it is one of the world's most diverse tourist destinations, combining ancient history, stunning nature, and modern cities.

Why Choose Mexico for Tourism or Visit?

A civilized destination combining ancient pyramids like Teotihuacan with modern landmarks in Mexico City.

A growing economy and business opportunities in tourism, agriculture, and industry.

Rich culture including music (Mariachi), famous Mexican cuisine, and traditional celebrations like the Day of the Dead.

What Makes Mexico Unique

Ancient Civilization: Home to remarkable heritage sites such as Mayan and Aztec temples.

Natural Diversity: From Caribbean beaches to deserts and mountains.

Blend of Past and Present: Modern cities stand alongside ancient archaeological sites.

Vibrant Culture: Includes arts, cuisine, and lively traditional festivals.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, spending a holiday, or attending cultural events.

Duration of Stay: Usually up to 180 days.

Required Documents: Valid passport (at least 6 months), recent personal photo, proof of financial capacity (bank statement), hotel reservation or travel itinerary, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Flexibility in stay, possibility of single or multiple entry.

2. Visit Visa (Family/Business)

Purpose: Visiting relatives or attending business meetings.

Duration of Stay: 30 â€“ 90 days, depending on the invitation.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the host (individual or company), proof of relationship, copy of the host's ID or residency in Mexico, bank statement for the visitor or host.

Features: Opportunity to spend time with family or develop business relations.

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through Mexico during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: Up to 7 days.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, visa for the final destination (if required).

Features: Some Mexican airports offer facilities for short transits.

4. Business Visa

Purpose: Commercial activities such as attending exhibitions, signing contracts, or exploring investment opportunities.

Duration of Stay: Usually 30 â€“ 90 days, with the possibility of multiple entry.

Required Documents: Official invitation letter from a Mexican company or institution, details of the business activity (contracts, exhibition invitations).

Features: Dedicated to merchants and businessmen, facilitating access to the Mexican market.

Costs

Tourist/Visit Visa: Approximately $36 â€“ $50 USD (depending on nationality).

Transit Visa: Often free or with a nominal fee.

Processing Time

Typically between 5 â€“ 10 working days.

An urgent service is available (2 â€“ 3 days) for an additional fee.

Important Tips

Passport must be valid for at least 6 months.

It is advisable to book an accredited hotel or provide clear proof of accommodation.

In the case of family or business visits, the clearer the invitation letter, the higher the chances of acceptance.

Top Tourist Attractions in Mexico

Teotihuacan Pyramids An ancient pre-Aztec city. Includes the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon.

Chichen Itza â€“ YucatÃ¡n A famous Mayan site. Features the stepped Kukulkan Pyramid.

CancÃºn â€“ Caribbean Coast A world-class beach destination. Perfect for diving and marine activities.

Mexico City The vibrant capital. Home to the National Museum of Anthropology and ZÃ³calo Square.

Guanajuato A colorful historic city listed by UNESCO. Known for its tunnels and lively markets.

Oaxaca A cultural hub rich in festivals and traditional cuisine.

Cabo San Lucas â€“ Pacific Coast A luxury resort town. Famous for its coastal scenery and natural rock formations.

Playa del Carmen â€“ Quintana Roo Located on the Caribbean coast, one of Mexicoâ€™s top destinations. Known for white sandy beaches, turquoise waters, and Quinta Avenida with restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Visitors can enjoy reef diving or day trips to nearby Cozumel Island. A blend of relaxation and adventure, where Caribbean charm meets modern Mexican culture.

Tulum â€“ YucatÃ¡n Peninsula An ancient Mayan city directly on the Caribbean coast. Its ruins overlook the sea, making it one of the worldâ€™s most unique archaeological sites. Visitors can enjoy pristine white beaches or explore famous cenotes (water caves) for swimming and diving. A destination combining history and nature, offering a unique experience of Mayan heritage and Caribbean beauty.

    Each landmark adds a different dimension: from ancient history to stunning beaches     and modern activities.

With Kaya, obtaining a Mexico visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.China Visas.docx:
China Visas

Overview

China's civilization spans over $5,000$ years, making it one of the world's oldest continuous civilizations. The first Chinese dynasties (Xia, Shang, Zhou) emerged along the Yellow River, witnessing great developments in philosophy, science, medicine, and arts. Empires like Han, Tang, and Song flourished and influenced Asian and global culture. In the 20th century, China became a republic, and today, it has evolved into one of the world's strongest economies, while preserving its ancient heritage and unique traditions.

Why Choose China for Tourism or Visit?

A civilized destination combining ancient history and modern landmarks: The Great Wall, the Forbidden City, and modern Shanghai.

A global economy and massive business opportunities.

Rich culture and a unique tourist experience.

What Makes China Unique

Ancient Civilization: A history spanning thousands of years, with unique imperial and religious landmarks.

Natural Diversity: From mountains and rivers to modern cities.

Blend of Past and Present: Skyscrapers stand alongside ancient temples.

Rich Culture: Includes arts, cuisine, and traditional festivals.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa (L Visa)

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, attending cultural events, or vacationing.

Duration of Stay: Usually 30 days, extendable.

Required Documents: Valid passport (at least 6 months), recent personal photo, bank statement proving financial capacity, hotel reservation or travel itinerary, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Possibility of single or multiple entry, flexibility in choosing the duration of stay.

2. Visit Visa (Family/Business Visit Visa)

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends, or attending business meetings.

Duration of Stay: 30 â€“ 90 days, depending on the invitation type.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the host (individual or company), proof of relationship, copy of the host's ID or residency in China, bank statement for the visitor or host.

Features: Opportunity to spend time with family or develop business relations, possibility of extension in some cases.

3. Transit Visa (G Visa)

Purpose: Passing through China during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: Up to 7 days (depending on the airport and city).

Features: Some Chinese cities (e.g., Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou) offer visa exemption for 72 â€“ 144 hours for transit, offering a chance to explore China during a short layover.

4. Business Visa (M Visa)

Purpose: Commercial and economic activities such as attending exhibitions, signing contracts, or exploring investment opportunities.

Duration of Stay: Usually 30 â€“ 90 days, with the possibility of multiple entry depending on the invitation.

Required Documents: Official invitation letter from an accredited Chinese company or institution, details of the business activity.

Features: Dedicated to merchants and businessmen, facilitates access to the massive Chinese market, possibility of obtaining a multiple-entry visa for continuous movement.

Costs

Tourist/Visit Visa: $60 â€“ $120 USD (depending on nationality and number of entries).

Transit Visa: Often free or with a nominal fee.

Processing Time

Typically between 5 â€“ 10 working days.

An urgent service is available (2 â€“ 3 days) for an additional fee.

Top Tourist Attractions in China

The Great Wall of China is considered one of the ancient wonders of the world, stretching over 8,850 km across northern China. Built in stages more than 2,000 years ago to protect the country from invasions. Today it is a national symbol and global tourist destination, where visitors can walk along sections and enjoy the surrounding landscapes.

Forbidden City â€“ Beijing A vast palace complex built in 1420, once the residence of emperors from the Ming and Qing dynasties. Includes more than 980 buildings and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Now the Palace Museum, showcasing rare artifacts from imperial China.

Temple of Heaven â€“ Beijing A religious complex built in 1420, used by emperors for rituals and prayers for good harvests. Features a unique circular architectural design symbolizing heaven and earth. Located within a large park, it is one of Beijingâ€™s most important spiritual landmarks.

Tiananmen Square â€“ Beijing The largest public square in the world, located in central Beijing. Includes landmarks such as the Monument to the Peopleâ€™s Heroes and the Great Hall of the People. A major cultural and political center, hosting national celebrations.

Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor â€“ Xiâ€™an Famous for the Terracotta Army. Contains thousands of clay statues of warriors, chariots, and horses crafted to protect the emperor in the afterlife. One of the most significant archaeological discoveries of the 20th century.

National Museum of China â€“ Beijing Located in Tiananmen Square, one of the largest museums in the world with an area of 204,000 mÂ². Houses over one million artifacts covering Chinaâ€™s history from ancient times to the modern era. Admission is free, making it a major cultural and educational center.

Futian Market â€“ Yiwu The largest wholesale market in the world, known as the Yiwu International Trade Market. Features thousands of shops offering products ranging from clothing to electronics. A key destination for traders and businesspeople worldwide.

Wangfujing Street â€“ Beijing One of Beijingâ€™s most famous shopping streets. Includes large stores, souvenir shops, and local food stalls. A favorite tourist spot for shopping and cultural experiences.

Chunxi Road â€“ Chengdu, Sichuan A lively shopping district combining traditional and modern stores. Offers restaurants serving local Sichuan cuisine. An ideal place for shopping and experiencing Sichuan culture.

Each destination in China tells a story and offers a unique experience that combines historical depth with natural charm.

With Kaya, obtaining a China visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.Japan Visas.docx:
Japan Visas

Overview

Japan is a country located in East Asia, consisting of an archipelago of over $6,800$ islands. Japan is renowned for its long history and rich culture, and it is considered one of the most technologically and economically advanced countries in the world. Its capital, Tokyo, is one of the largest and most bustling cities globally.

Japan has a long and complex history spanning thousands of years. Its civilization began in the Yamato period in the 3rd century AD, developing its culture through interaction with China and Korea. Throughout the centuries, Japan saw great development, from the Middle Ages, ruled by Samurai families, to the modern period in the late 19th century, when it began opening up to the West and adopting industrial modernization.

Japan became a major power in the 20th century, playing a significant role in World War II. After the war, Japan underwent massive rebuilding and became one of the strongest economies globally. Today, Japan is a highly advanced industrial nation, with tremendous progress in technology and innovation.

Prefectures and Regions of Japan

Honshu: The largest island, home to major cities such as Tokyo, Osaka, and Kyoto.

Hokkaido: Located in the north, famous for its stunning natural scenery and cold winters, making it a popular destination for winter sports.

Kyushu: Situated in the southwest, known for its many historical and cultural sites.

Okinawa: A group of islands in southern Japan, characterized by a tropical climate and beautiful beaches.

Shikoku: The smallest of the four main islands, renowned for its rural landscapes and religious sites.

Nagoya Prefecture: Located in central Japan, an important industrial and commercial hub.

Osaka Prefecture: Located in southern Japan, a major cultural and commercial center.

Kyoto Prefecture: One of Japanâ€™s most historic cities, considered a center of traditional arts and culture.

Why Choose Japan for Tourism or Visit?

A unique destination combining ancient traditions (temples, Japanese gardens) with stunning modernity (Tokyo skyscrapers, advanced technology).

Global cities like Tokyo, Kyoto, and Osaka.

Rich culture, world-class cuisine, and an unforgettable travel experience.

What Makes Japan Unique

Blend of Past and Present: Historic temples and castles stand alongside modern skyscrapers.

Unique Culture: Japanese traditions such as Shintoism and Buddhism coexist with advanced technology.

Stunning Nature: Mountains, gardens, and cherry blossoms attract millions of tourists every year.

Safety and Order: Japan is known as one of the safest and most orderly countries in the world.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, shopping, attending cultural events.

Duration of Stay: Usually 15 â€“ 30 days, extendable in some cases.

Required Documents: Valid passport (at least 6 months), recent personal photo, bank statement proving financial capacity, hotel reservation or travel itinerary, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Possibility of single or multiple entry (depending on the visa type), flexibility in choosing the duration of stay.

2. Visit Visa (Family/Friends)

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in Japan.

Duration of Stay: 15 â€“ 90 days, depending on the invitation.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the host in Japan, proof of relationship, copy of the host's ID or residency, bank statement for the visitor or host.

Features: Opportunity to spend time with family or friends, possibility of extension in some cases.

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through Japan during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: Up to 72 hours.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, visa for the final destination (if required).

Features: Low fees, opportunity to explore Tokyo or Osaka during a short layover.

Costs

Tourist/Visit Visa: Approximately $30 â€“ $50 USD.

Transit Visa: Nominal fee or sometimes free.

Processing Time

Typically between 5 â€“ 10 working days.

It is advisable to apply well in advance of the travel date (3 â€“ 4 weeks).

Top Tourist Attractions in Japan

Fushimi Inari A Shinto shrine dating back to 711 AD. Famous for its hundreds of red Torii gates forming a magical pathway along the mountain slope. Open 24 hours and one of Kyotoâ€™s most visited sites.

Tokyo Tower A landmark reminiscent of the Eiffel Tower, standing 333 meters tall. Features observation decks offering panoramic views of Tokyo. Open until 11 PM and considered a symbol of modern Japan.

Meiji Jingu A majestic Shinto shrine located in a forest in central Tokyo. Built in honor of Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken. Includes a seasonal iris garden and is one of the most important spiritual sites.

Tokyo Disneyland A branch of the world-famous theme park, opened in 1983. Offers rides, live shows, and beloved Disney characters. An ideal destination for families and children, closing at 10 PM.

Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden A vast park covering 58.2 hectares. Includes diverse gardens (Japanese, English, French) and a greenhouse. A perfect spot for cherry blossom viewing in spring.

Himeji Castle (White Heron Castle) A historic castle from the 17th century, known for its distinctive white faÃ§ade. Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Considered one of Japanâ€™s most beautiful and best-preserved castles.

Nara Park A famous public park in Nara city. Home to ancient temples and the Nara National Museum of Art. Renowned for its tame deer roaming freely among visitors.

Yoyogi Park A spacious park in Tokyo, once the site of the 1964 Olympic Village. Features lakes, fountains, and dense woodlands. An ideal place for picnics and outdoor activities.

Mount Fuji is Japan's highest peak at 3,776 meters. A national symbol and UNESCO World Heritage Site. A popular destination for climbing, photography, and enjoying breathtaking scenery.

Japan is a destination that combines natural beauty, technological advancement, and deep history, making it one of the worldâ€™s most remarkable places to visit!

With Kaya, obtaining a Japan visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.UAE Visas.docx:
UAE Visas

Overview

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a country located in the Arabian Gulf region of the Middle East. It was established on December 2, 1971, following the union of seven emirates: Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Umm Al-Quwain, Fujairah, and Ras Al Khaimah. Its capital is Abu Dhabi, and Dubai is the largest and most globally famous city in the UAE.

The UAE is one of the most developed countries in the world, distinguished by advanced infrastructure and a prosperous economy. Its economy relies significantly on oil and natural gas, in addition to the tourism and trade sectors.

The modern history of the UAE dates back to 1971 when the United Arab Emirates was established after the union of the seven emirates. This union was led by the late Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, considered the nation's founding father. The UAE's development was greatly accelerated by the discovery of oil in the 1950s and 60s, which contributed significantly to the nation's progress and the high standard of living for its citizens.

Emirates of the UAE

Abu Dhabi: The political and administrative capital of the UAE, and the largest emirate by area. Home to major cultural landmarks such as the Louvre Abu Dhabi and Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque.

Dubai: One of the worldâ€™s most famous global cities. Known for its towering skyscrapers like Burj Khalifa. A leading tourist and commercial hub attracting visitors from all over the world.

Sharjah: Recognized as the cultural capital of the Arab world. Features numerous museums, cultural centers, and historical landmarks.

Ajman: The smallest emirate in the UAE. Famous for its beautiful beaches and strategic location.

Umm Al-Quwain: A quiet emirate known for its beaches, water activities, and aquatic sports.

Fujairah: Located on the UAEâ€™s eastern coast. Distinguished by its beaches and stunning mountains.

Ras Al Khaimah: Known for its diverse natural attractions, including mountains and beaches. Also home to many historical sites.

Why Choose the UAE for Tourism or Visit?

A global destination combining modernity and heritage: Burj Khalifa, Louvre Abu Dhabi, the Arabian Desert.

Vibrant cities like Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah.

A global shopping hub and host to international events year-round.

What Makes the UAE Unique

Tourism Diversity: From deserts and natural islands to modern cities full of activities.

Architectural Modernity: Home to the worldâ€™s tallest tower (Burj Khalifa) and the largest shopping malls.

Authenticity and Heritage: Landmarks such as Qasr Al Hosn and the Heritage Village reflect the UAEâ€™s rich history.

Safety and Openness: The UAE is known as one of the safest countries, welcoming visitors from all nationalities.

Cultural Fusion: A diverse society that blends authentic Arab traditions with global openness.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, shopping, attending events and exhibitions.

Types:

Short-term: 30 days.

Long-term: 90 days.

Required Documents: Valid passport (at least 6 months), recent personal photo, hotel reservation or proof of accommodation, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Possibility of single or multiple entry, fast processing (usually within 2 â€“ 5 working days).

2. Family Visit Visa

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in the UAE.

Duration of Stay: 30 â€“ 90 days, depending on the invitation type.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the UAE resident, copy of the host's UAE residency, proof of relationship, bank statement for the visitor or host.

Features: Gives you the opportunity to spend time with family, possibility of extension in some cases.

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through the UAE during your journey to another destination.

Types: 48 hours and 96 hours.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, hotel reservation or proof of short-term accommodation.

Features: Very low fees (AED 50 â€“ 100), ideal for short layovers and exploring Dubai or Abu Dhabi.

Costs

30-Day Tourist Visa: Starts from AED 200 â€“ 350, depending on the issuing authority.

90-Day Tourist Visa: Ranges between AED 600 â€“ 800.

Transit Visa: Usually between AED 50 â€“ 100.

Processing Time

Usually between 2 â€“ 7 working days.

Some applications can be processed urgently within 24 hours.

Top Tourist Attractions in the UAE

Burj Khalifa â€“ Dubai The tallest tower in the world at 828 meters. Features panoramic observation decks, luxury restaurants, and offices. A global symbol of modernity and architectural progress.

Ferrari World â€“ Yas Island, Abu Dhabi A theme park inspired by Ferrari cars. Offers thrilling rides including the worldâ€™s fastest roller coaster. An ideal destination for families and car enthusiasts.

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo One of the largest indoor aquariums in the world. Home to thousands of marine creatures, including sharks and rays. A unique experience through a glass tunnel beneath the water.

Dubai Fountain â€“ Burj Khalifa The largest dancing fountain in the world, with water reaching up to 140 meters. Daily musical and light shows attract thousands of visitors.

Qasr Al Hosn â€“ Abu Dhabi The oldest historical building in Abu Dhabi, dating back to the 18th century. Once the seat of government and a center of political and social life. Today it is a museum showcasing the UAEâ€™s history and culture.

Heritage Village â€“ Abu Dhabi A reconstructed traditional desert village. Displays the old Emirati lifestyle and traditional crafts. An ideal place to explore local heritage.

Emirates Park Zoo A family-friendly zoo featuring elephants, giraffes, and bird shows. Offers interactive activities such as animal feeding.

Qasr Al Watan â€“ Presidential Palace, Abu Dhabi A modern architectural masterpiece. Open to visitors to explore halls of governance and hospitality. Reflects the grandeur of Emirati architecture and leadership spirit.

Palm Islands â€“ Dubai A group of iconic artificial islands. Home to resorts, villas, and advanced tourist facilities.

The United Arab Emirates represents a unique blend of modernity and tradition, offering visitors exceptional opportunities for cultural and recreational experiences.

With Kaya, obtaining a UAE visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

Qatar Visas

Overview

Qatar is a country located on the Arabian Peninsula bordering the Persian Gulf, and it is considered one of the wealthiest countries in the world due to its natural gas and oil reserves. Doha is the capital and largest city of Qatar.

The country is distinguished by its strategic geographical location, making it a connection point between Asia and the West. Despite its small size, Qatar holds a strong global economic position and plays an influential role in international politics.

Qatar is a modern and developed nation, having seen significant progress in various fields such as education, health, infrastructure, and sports. The state also seeks to develop various types of tourism as part of its strategy to diversify the national economy away from oil.

Qatar's history dates back to ancient times, having been inhabited for thousands of years. In the Middle Ages, Qatar was part of the Islamic Caliphate and underwent many invasions and political transformations. In the 19th century, Qatar came under British control until it gained full independence in 1971.

The ruling Al Thani family has governed Qatar since 1868 and is the family that contributed to the country's modern renaissance. Since the discovery of oil in the 1970s, Qatar has witnessed a massive transformation in its economy and infrastructure, making it one of the richest countries globally.

Municipalities of Qatar

Doha: The capital and largest city of Qatar. Home to many tourist and commercial landmarks such as the Doha Corniche, Souq Waqif, and the Museum of Islamic Art.

Al Rayyan: The largest municipality by area. Includes cultural and sports landmarks such as Khalifa International Stadium.

Al Wakrah: A historic coastal city, attractive for family tourism. Famous for its beaches and resorts.

Al Khor: Located in the north, known for its beautiful beaches. A coastal city famous for fishing and aquaculture.

Al Shamal: Situated in northern Qatar, focused on nature conservation. Includes several protected areas.

Umm Salal: Located north of Doha. Renowned for its rich cultural history.

Al Daayen: Located near Doha. A residential area with notable urban development.

Al Jassasiya (Southern Qatar): Known for its cultural history and archaeological sites.

Why Choose Qatar for Tourism or Visit?

A modern destination combining authenticity and modernity: Souq Waqif, National Museum of Qatar, Katara, The Pearl.

Developed infrastructure and Hamad International Airport, one of the world's best.

A safe and hospitable environment, ideal for families and visitors from the Gulf and the Arab world.

What Makes Qatar Unique

Authenticity and Heritage: Landmarks such as Al Zubarah Fort and Souq Waqif reflect Qatarâ€™s rich history.

Modernity and Development: Urban and cultural projects like Katara and The Pearl showcase Qatarâ€™s progress.

Geographical Location: Overlooking the Arabian Gulf, offering stunning beaches and coastal views.

Tourism Diversity: From museums and mosques to gardens, beaches, and resorts.

Types of Visas

1. Tourist Visa

Purpose: Visiting tourist attractions, shopping, attending sports or cultural events.

Duration of Stay: Usually 30 days, extendable in some cases.

Required Documents: Valid passport (at least 6 months), recent personal photo, hotel reservation or proof of accommodation, confirmed return ticket.

Features: Possibility of online application via visa platforms, fast processing (usually within a few days).

2. Family Visit Visa

Purpose: Visiting relatives or friends residing in Qatar.

Duration of Stay: 30 â€“ 90 days, depending on the invitation type.

Required Documents: Invitation letter from the Qatar resident, proof of relationship, copy of the host's Qatari residency, proof of financial capacity for the visitor or host.

Features: Gives you the opportunity to spend time with family, possibility of extension in some cases.

3. Transit Visa

Purpose: Passing through Qatar during your journey to another destination.

Duration of Stay: 5 â€“ 96 hours.

Required Documents: Confirmed travel ticket to the final destination, visa for the final destination (if required).

Features: Often free for travelers via Hamad International Airport, opportunity to explore Doha on a short layover.

Costs

Tourist Visa: Approximately QAR 100 (Qatari Riyal).

Visit Visa: Varies depending on the duration (QAR 100 â€“ 200).

Transit Visa: Mostly free.

Processing Time

Usually between 2 â€“ 7 working days.

It is advisable to apply well in advance of the travel date.

Top Tourist Attractions in Qatar

Pearl Monument â€“ Doha Corniche Located on the Doha Corniche, one of the most iconic heritage symbols. A sculpture of an open oyster shell with flowing water, symbolizing Qatarâ€™s maritime history and pearl diving. A popular photo spot and a perfect place for a stroll along the Corniche.

Museum of Islamic Art Park A spacious waterfront park surrounding the Museum of Islamic Art. Offers green areas for family picnics and stunning views of Dohaâ€™s skyline. An ideal place for sports, relaxation, and outdoor leisure.

June 5th Arch A prominent memorial in Doha. Features modern architectural design and attracts visitors for photography and exploration.

Katara Mosque A stunning mosque with colorful tilework and golden decorations. Located in the Katara Cultural Village, considered one of the most beautiful modern mosques in Qatar. Reflects Islamic artistic and architectural elegance.

Museum of Islamic Art â€“ Doha One of the worldâ€™s leading museums, opened in 2008 and designed by renowned architect I. M. Pei. Showcases the development of Islamic art over more than 1,400 years. Houses rare artifacts from across the Islamic world.

Katara Cultural Village A modern coastal district combining culture and arts. Includes a theatre, museum, conference center, restaurants, shops, and a beach. An ideal destination to experience Qatari culture and enjoy artistic and musical events.

Al Zubarah Fort A historic fort built in 1938 from coral stone and mud. One of Qatarâ€™s most important archaeological sites, housing exhibitions and artifacts. Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering insights into Qatarâ€™s military and cultural history.

Al Zubair Farm & Resort A rural-style tourist destination. Provides recreational activities and relaxation facilities, making it a family-friendly option.

The Pearl-Qatar A luxurious man-made island north of Doha. Features a marina, international restaurants, and upscale shopping centers. Known as the â€œArabian Riviera,â€ a prime destination for luxury and leisure.

Qatar is a leading tourist destination that offers visitors a unique blend of culture, luxury, and Arabian hospitality.



With Kaya, obtaining a Qatar visa becomes an easy and secure step, allowing you to start your journey with confidence and peace of mind.

files.Travel Visas_.docx:
Travel Visas with Kaya

Your Journey Starts Here

At Kaya, we believe that travel is not just a movement from one place to another; it is a life experience that begins the moment your visa is processed. We provide you with integrated services for obtaining tourism, visit, and transit visas to the most important global and regional destinations, with diligent follow-up on every detail until you receive your visa.

Types of Visas We Offer

Tourist Visa: For enjoying tourist destinations, cultural landmarks, and unique experiences.

Visit Visa: For visiting family and friends or attending special occasions.

Transit Visa: For passing through a specific country during your journey to another destination.

Why Choose Kaya?

Extensive experience in processing tourist and visit visas.

Personalized follow-up of your file step-by-step.

Continuous updates on embassy requirements.

Full support before, during, and after travel.

With Kaya, your visa is not just a document; it is the start of your journey toward a safe and enjoyable travel experience.

files.European Blue Card Visa (EU Blue Card) 1:
European Blue Card Visa (EU Blue Card)

Overview

The European Blue Card is one of the most important work and residence permits in Europe, specifically designed for highly qualified professionals from outside the European Union. This card grants you the opportunity to legally work and reside in an EU member state, with the possibility of moving to other countries later, making it a strategic choice for building a professional future and a stable life in the heart of Europe.

The Importance of the Blue Card

Addressing the European Labor Market Shortage: The card targets experts in demanded fields such as IT, engineering, medicine, and science.

Freedom of Movement: After a certain period of residence, you can move to another European country without needing to start the procedures from scratch.

Family Stability: It allows for simplified and fast family reunification.

Permanent Residency Opportunity: In some countries like Germany, you can apply for permanent residency after only 21â€“27 months if you are proficient in the German language.

Main Countries Offering the Blue Card

Germany ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª: The most sought-after destination due to its strong economy and diverse job opportunities.

France ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·: An environment rich with opportunities in research, engineering, and science.

Spain ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸: An attractive option for professionals seeking a blend of professional life and vibrant culture.

Note: Almost all EU member states offer the Blue Card, with the exception of Denmark and Ireland.

Essential Requirements for the Blue Card

A recognized university degree or equivalent professional qualification.

A job contract or job offer from an employer in the European Union.

A minimum annual salary threshold (varies by country, e.g., in Germany: â‚¬48,300 in 2025, or â‚¬43,759 for shortage occupations).

Health insurance covering the period of residence.

Proof that the job is related to your academic or professional specialization.

Steps to Obtain the Blue Card

Secure a job contract from a European company or institution.

Ensure your qualifications are recognized (e.g., via the ZAB office in Germany).

Prepare documents: passport, photos, job contract, academic qualification, proof of salary, health insurance.

Submit the application at the embassy, consulate, or immigration office in the target country.

Wait for the decision (may take from 8 weeks to several months, depending on the country).

Receive the Blue Card and start working.

Required Documents

1. Personal Documents

Valid passport (preferably covering the entire expected duration of stay).

Recent personal photos (compliant with European biometric standards: 35x45 mm, light background).

2. Academic and Professional Documents

Recognized university degree or equivalent (must be officially recognized in the target country).

Qualification recognition certificate (e.g., via ZAB or ANABIN database in Germany).

Experience letters or previous employment contracts to prove professional experience.

3. Employment Contract and Income Proof

Signed employment contract or official job offer from an EU employer.

Proof of annual salary (must exceed the minimum required in the country, e.g., â‚¬48,300 in Germany for 2025, or â‚¬43,759 for shortage occupations).

4. Financial and Insurance Documents

Proof of financial capacity (usually through the employment contract itself, but a bank statement may be requested).

Comprehensive health insurance covering the residence period from the first day.

5. Additional Documents

Completed and signed National Visa (D-Visa) application form.

Updated CV according to European standards (Europass CV).

Motivation Letter explaining your choice of the country and job.

Marriage or birth certificates (if applying with family).

Important Notes:

All non-English or non-German documents must be certified translation and legalized.

Some European countries may request additional specific documents (such as a clear criminal record or a health certificate).

Originals and copies must be submitted together upon application.

Documents vary slightly from one country to another, but Germany, France, and Spain have similar essential requirements.

Timeframe

The card is usually granted for 4 years or the contract duration plus 3 months.

The processing time can be lengthy (sometimes several months), especially in high-demand countries like Germany.

Fees and Costs in Detail

1. Official Fees

National Visa (D-Visa) application fee: approximately â‚¬75 (paid at the German Embassy/Consulate).

Residence permit fee (upon arrival in Germany): between â‚¬100 â€“ â‚¬140 for issuing the Blue Card.

Card renewal fee: between â‚¬80 â€“ â‚¬100, depending on the extension duration.

2. Additional Costs

Health Insurance: Mandatory throughout the stay, costs vary depending on the type of insurance (public or private), typically between â‚¬100 â€“ â‚¬400 per month.

Proof of Financial Capacity: The applicant must prove an annual income of at least â‚¬48,300 (2025) or â‚¬43,759 for shortage occupations (such as IT, medicine, and engineering).

Translation and Legalization of Certificates: May range between â‚¬200 â€“ â‚¬600, depending on the number of documents.

Personal Photos and Additional Service Fees: Approximately â‚¬20 â€“ â‚¬50.

Important Notes:

Fees are non-refundable even if the application is rejected.

Costs vary slightly from one European country to another, but Germany is considered the most common destination.

The card is usually granted for 4 years or the contract duration plus 3 months, with the possibility of extension.

Key Advantages

Legal residence and work in the EU.

Family reunification.

Possibility of moving to other European countries after a period of residence.

Application for permanent residency after a specified period.

What We Offer You at Kaya

Specialized consultations to determine your eligibility for the Blue Card.

Preparation of your academic and professional file according to the requirements of each country.

Step-by-step follow-up of the application until visa issuance.

Additional support for your family in case of family reunification application.

Guidance after arrival regarding registration and integration into the labor market.

With Kaya, the European Blue Card is not just a work permit; it is the beginning of a new life in the heart of Europe.
